reviews.review: Pylon lookout . Great view for photos, climbing the 200 steps to the top was well worth it for the view, recommended highly although hard to find entrance. Start by finding the stairs to the bridge then walk along the bridge for a bit and find entrance.

Excellent way for happy medium to view Sydney from the bridge. This option for the bridge is $20 as opposed to $300+ - we were advised the price was going up for the actual climb. You do have a trek to the top of the lookout and so I would not suggest it for the young, meek, elderly. I am none of those and I found myself grateful when we arrived at the gift shop - which was a hair away from being at the top but I needed the break from the step climb. I can only imagine on a clear day how phenomenal this would have been - but it still was just a really nice way to look out over the city of Sydney and then walk some portion of the bridge after that. You can walk all around the lookout so you do get a 360 degree view. Highly recommend.

Try it. If you dont fancy a bridge climb, try this. There are over 200 steps to the top but there is a gift shop half way for a break.. Take your time with the steps. The view makes it all worthwhile. Spend some time here. Its just great.

Pylon lookout Sydney harbour bridge. Great way to see the views of Sydney. Would not recommend for young children as there are approximately 200 steps to get to the top. There is a little museum that has displays regarding the history of the bridge, a small shop where you can purchase drinks, souvenirs etc. The view is great as you can walk all around the top of the pylon and take your camera as well. Cost is very reasonable and you can stay as long as you like.

Awesome views. A bit difficult to find the right road to walk along, but when you get there it is worth the $13 entry fee. History of the bridge build is available as you climb the 200 stairs to the top where you will find spectacular views of the bridge, Opera House and harbour.

What a view. We had a voucher from a recent Bridge Climb and decided to visit and we were glad we did.If you had visitors to Sydney and could not afford the Bridge Climb, but wanted similar views, then this is the attraction to visit.

Save the $13, and just walk over. . I have done the bridgeclimb, the pylon lookout and just walked across the bridge. $13 gives you a half decent view, but I didn't think it was much better than walking across and could not compare it to actually climbing the bridge at all. If anything, I thought getting to the pylon lookout was harder going than climbing the bridge!In my opinion, just walking across the bridge is just fine and free. Take a train to Milsons Point and then walk back over bridge to the rocks/Circular Quay.

Awesome view! A better alternative than doing the bridge climb, unless.... This is the pylon lookout, as opposed to the bridge climb. We investigated doing the bridge climb, but it wasn't worth it for us.The Pylon Lookout - the walk over the bridge provides a fantastic view even if you don't do the pylon lookout or bridge climb. However, the pylon lookout does get you higher, with some unobstructed views of the Opera House and that side of the harbor. It's a great view, a good hike, and doesn't take too much time out of your day. Definitely worth it.The Bridge Climb - we chose not to do this due to the cost and, most importantly, because they do not let you take a camera up with you. Although I understand that they do not want you to drop anything on the cars below, such a restriction kind of defeats one of the main goals of getting that high above the harbor. They also make you wear a jumpsuit, so, sneaking a camera probably isn't easy (nor am I suggesting you should try). The novelty for the bridge climb is the height and open feel of being on the bridge. We are rock climbers and felt that the height novelty wouldn't really justify the cost, which is prohibitive. If you want the rush of being high up, my suggestion is to do one of the great hikes in the Blue Mountains that is exposed and do the Pylon Lookout in Sydney for the harbor view. You'll save time, money, and probably get an overall better Sydney area experience. That being said, if the bridge climb is something you really think you'd enjoy, then you probably will - try not to think about the cost and have a great time!

Spectacular view and the museum is worth checking out!. This is worth seeking out for the view alone. I have been in good and bad weather, and it wasn't a let down even in the rain! The museum is part of the fee to get in for the lookout, and I highly recommend giving yourself at least 30-45 minutes if you're at all interested in history. A fascinating look at the building of the bridge. I'll probably return on each visit to Sydney.

Go here instead of the bridgeclimb. The Pylon lookout is easy to reach, has heaps of information about how the bridge was built and how it was used since. The main attraction is the lookout with a fantastic view to the opera house and the city, which is almost as high as you get with the bridgeclimb. So it is a great much cheaper alternative which also takes less time.

Must . Again it's one of those things you have to do if you go to Sidney
It's along walk but you can take some grate pictures

Birds eye view of the harbour . I never knew about this pylon lookout until a friend recommended it, but with the bridge walk being way out of our price range this was a great budget option. I showed my student card and got in as a concession meaning it cost me under $10. It took us under two hours to go around the museum and take in the spectacular view at the top, but I suppose it could take longer or shorter depending how long you want to spend reading information etc. But there is no rush you just make your own way to the various levels in your own time. I never realised I knew so little about Sydney harbour bridge, so I would recommend this activity as I learnt so many interesting facts. It was such a clear day when we went up and good to watch the world go by below.
Great Views Of the Harbour. Great views of the Harbor and opera House very interesting history of the bridge .well worth the entry fee

Great alternative to Bridge Climb. We are sydney locals and have never done this walk - we highly recommend it. There's no way that I could cope with a bridge walk so this was the next best thing. It's 200 stairs walk up the pylon for a great view.

Walk the bridge. If you are not up to a Bridge climb (I am scared of heights!) then a walk up the pylon and out onto the bridge is a great second option, you get to see the Harbour, Opera House etc and when on the bridge you must remember to look up and admire the bridge itself!

Different perspective on the harbour and opera house. We had free passes for the Pylon lookout after doing the Bridge Climb a few days before. We almost didn't bother but glad we did as the views are impressive with an alternative view down onto the Opera House, harbour and the bridge itself from what we had experienced before. It certainly wasn't a wasted trip in our view and i would say that if you are traveling on a budget then this is a 'must do' to get a great view of Sydney's icon architecture, even if you dont go up the pylon the walk up from Cumberland St in The Rocks and across the bridge walkway is exhilarating. Views are equally impressive and cost you nothing!

Fantastic views. Don't miss a walk across the bridge if you are ever in Sydney. This isn't the bridge climb just a walk on the pedestrian way about 1k?? The pavement is next to the very busy road so noisy but when you get to the concrete pylon pay 13dolllars and climb 200?steps and end up at the very top looking at the bridge from on the top.worth the effort to climb. Great experience and the views fantastic.

Perfect place to get a view of the harbor and Opera House.. The lookout is not the place you want to be if you don't wanna have a view of the Opera house and the harbor skyline... 5 syra for Uninterrupted views.. and its easily reachable from The Rocks area...
Excellent vview of the harbour and the city. A nice walk, good exercise and a great way to view the harbor and the city. You can go at your own pace.

Pylon lookout is not a MUST Visit tourist area. Many reviews I read that this is a MUST visit place to see the spectacular Sydney Opera House. To my disappointment, you can eliminate this especially if you have the Harbour Ferry in your itinerary. The view that you are seeing is just the same Sydney Opera House. The view from the Ferry have better glimpse and even more relaxing. Beware..... Walking up the Pylon Lookout is not recommended for elderly. I don't suggest this tourist spot as it waste your time seeing the same scenery on just a different angle.

A cheaper alternative to the expensive Harbour Bridge climb.. I always thought that it would be cool to climb the bridge until I found out how much it was going to cost me! After that I found out about the Pylon Lookout, and I have to say, I'm not even interested in climbing the bridge anymore.The lookout is located in one of the towers of the Harbour Bridge, the one that's closer to The Rocks, and you can access it from the walking path of the bridge. Tickets are not expensive. You just need to climb a couple of steps and you make it to the top. The view from there is breathtaking, you can see the Opera House, Circular Quay, the CBD, Barangaroo, North Sydney...and all around the Harbour (like a 360º experience); you're so close to the bridge that you feel like you could touch it. It's definitely a Must-see in Sydney!

View is almost as good as the Bridge Climb, and much cheaper.... Despite living in Sydney for decades, we finally got around to walking across the 'coat hanger', as it is affectionately known, from North Sydney through Kirribilli to head off to the South Pylon.Having chosen a nice day, we had extensive 360 degree views. The quoted 200 steps wasn't too hard, and you get to stop part way up to pay the entrance fee, before continuing to the top.The displays and video show some very interesting history of the Bridge.If you don't do the Bridge Climb, this is a must do alternative ,,, or why not do both?

Free when you climb the bridge!. They give you a free ticket to the Pylon when you climb the Sydney Harbour Bridge. I made sure to use mine on a different day so I could experience those stunning views again. You can just buy a ticket for the Pylon itself if climbing the bridge doesn't interest you. It's a bit windy up there, so take a hair tie! You can walk all the way around it for 360° views.

Great. Great location to take the whole city in. The 200 steps (as stated on info) is really not as scary as it sound. Spectacular view to show the city off to the visitors or even just to take a moment. Entry fee applies (last entry is at 4:45. 8.5$ for students and $13 for adults).

Tough to find. The bridge climb is hard to find. Here are some directions that work... First from the main harbor area walk along Cahill expressway towards the rocks (an area of Sydney). Turn right on George Street. Turn left on Argyle street and walk up the hill. Just before the big underpass turn right on Argyle steps (sign on wall above entry). At the top go out towards the road (Cumberland). Go across and a little left to bridge steps. Go to the top and you will find the pedestrian pathway going across the bridge. The pylon climb is in the first pylon you come to. Fantastic views of Sydney harbor and Opera house. Costs $13. Good luck.

Great views, nice little museum. Although the views aren't quite as brilliant as being on the Sydney Harbour Bridge itself, the Pylon comes fairly close. It's also much cheaper and you can bring your own camera up with you to take some great shots of the Harbour. Plus, you can get free entry for a limited time after you do the climb up the bridge which is pretty great. Would recommend.

Great views with a dose of history. Entry cost of aud 13 totally worth it for the great views and photo Ops.Amazing views of the bridge, the opera house and the city. Don't forget to check out the museum with very interesting info about the bridge and a nice little video which is played in the room just before the exit. Neat little souvenir shop which has some very interesting items not limited to the bridge. The visit should take approx an hour.
Good views. Well worth a visit great views of Harbour and city good choice if you do not want to do the Bridge Climb - entry is free if you have done the Bridge Climb.

Fabulous.. What a truly amazing experience. High up above the city and harbour you get the most amazing 360* views. There is a history of the bridge with artefacts , documentary film and so much more, like a mini bridge museum that gives you a great appreciation and understanding of the construction of the bridge and the times in which it was constructed. And for only $13 you can't beat it for value. Don't forget your camera as the views will amaze you.

worth the $26 Australian dollars for two!. If you cannot justify the cost of the bridge climb like us, the pylon lookout is the cheaper alternative. You pretty much see the same view for much less. We happened to come here on a slow day and the view was amazing! Just take your time walking up. There are bathroom and water fountain inside.
Great views.. Sensational views. Great economical alternative to the bridge climb. An absolute must do. Walk across the bridge and catch the train back.

Good Value and informative. Almost the same view as you get doing the bridge climb at a fraction of the price also informative about the construction of the bridge. If you are there in the winter do it around 4.00p.m and you will see the sunset too. They don't check ID too muchto give the student discount
Best way to get excellent views of the Harbour. We climbed the 200 steps and paused half way to learn about the history of the bridge. Outstanding views.
very nice. Although not that much higher than being on the bridge itself, they do charge a fee to climb 3 flights of stairs....It's not expensive if you're after great photo's
Great views. I definitely recommend coming up here. It's quite a quick excursion. I think I only spent 30min here but it was good to see the city and learn some history.
City views that Don't cost a Fortune. The views were great and the cost minimal compared to the bridge climb. The short film was interesting. Worth the climb.

Pylon Perfection. This is a tour one can do independently or it is included (at a time of your choosing within 30 days) if you do a Bridge Climb. Regardless, it is well worth doing. There is a great explanatory museum of the history of the bridge along with some artifacts to review prior to climbing up. Once you arrive, be prepared to be amazed by wonderful views and don't be frightened when a cockatoo (or two or three) flies past your head and lands near you, screeching all the way.

Absolutely Fantastic View of Sydney City. I did a shoot for a calendar for my relatives and friends last year and decided to go up here and take some shots. It is worth every step up there and does not cost a fortune, just a bit of exercise.

Why do the bridge walk?. Why spend $100's on the bridge walk when you can go up here, this is an awesome lookout over the city and harbour. Maybe not as high as the main walk but for the price it is brilliant. It can be a little hard to find if walking from the Rocks. But there is a set of stairs that take you up onto the bridge above The Rocks. This will lead you too the right place. Pylon company should put up just a couple of signs for tourists to find it a bit easier as we had people asking us which way it was.

on a clear day you can see forever??. cheaper alternative to the bridge walk, and not as high, but still good views. nice museum inside that gives you the historical context for the bridge. I would say this and views from a ferry are nice as a part of sydney harbour and opera house portfolio...
Great views. Climbed the pylon lookout. Amazing views of Sydney . Also a museum inside very interesting . Lots of history , pictures artefacts & souvenirs available .

What an interesting , cheapstake view to climb the Sydney Harbour. Its very convenient if you have kids who would like to have a look at the Sydney Harbour from the top ( well almost the top ) or if you are looking something less expensive compared to the Bridge Climb !Pick a perfect day and up you go ..200 stairs and voila ! Its 360 degree view of Sydney ..breathless. Loads of history and facts to read while you climb up !! For a mere 13$, its a must for every visitor !

A good alternative to BridgeClimb. Located in the south-east pylon of the Harbour Bridge, the Pylon Lookout can be reached from Milsons Point/Kirrinbilli, The Rocks or the Cahill Walk. We took the glass lift (not well marked, but behind the palm trees to the right after you leave the train station) up to the Cahill Walk from Circular Quay - it is also accessible via steps from Macquarie Street. The walk offers spectacular views over the harbour, bridge and Opera House and there's seating and a history panel along the way. About halfway along the walk, the Pylon Lookout has a small museum and theatrette on one level, a souvenir shop and display of historic souvenirs further up and a walk-around parapet at the top. At $13 ($8.50 for seniors), it's a good alternative to BridgeClimb with plenty of dining options in Kirribilli at the end. The walk is around 3 km, and there's a ferry from Milsons Point back to Circular Quay.

Great views. After doing the Bridge Climb, we got tickets for the Pylon Lookout. Since you can't take cameras on the bridge climb, it was great to go to the Pylon and take amazing photos of Sydney Harbour and the bridge. The climb to the top is fairly easy and well worth it for the great views. The history of the bridge was really interesting. This is a definite must do in Sydney and can easily be added to a walk around the harbour. In the Pylon are bathrooms and a little shop. To get to the Pylon Lookout, you walk partly across the bridge.
Do this. For the low cost of $13 you have superb views of Sydney Harbour from the top of the pylon. Picture postcard views.You can spend as long as you like there. Quite a few steps.

just do. If you are a history buff or just interested in how the bridge was built this is the place for you,stay as long as you like lots of old photos and interesting stuff to see very interesting would go back,great view from the top looking on the bridge deck and views all round

Great view of the Sydney CBD skyline and the Opera House at a cheaper price!. This place is a must-visit for every tourist. Take the 200+ steps going up to get a grand view of the Sydney Opera House and Circular Quay. This is a cheaper alternative than doing the Sydney Harbour Bridge climb. No time limit as well!

Inexpensive, fabulous views. Inexpensive with fabulous views to all ends of the harbour. A few stairs to climb though and can be very windy up top. Interesting history of the bridge inside but mostly it is the views you will want to go for. Can be done as part of walk around Circular Quay and Darling Harbour making a pleasant outing.

Well worthwhile . Did the pylon lookout last weekend. I went will my 2 sons. We all found it very interesting. There was plenty of information & history available to look at & read. Ultimately you get to the top & look out over our spectacular harbour & city scape. I highly recommend doing it.
Short walk but worth the view. Great view out to sydney Heads. Very short walk from the Rocks/Circular Quay. A good trip on a sunny day. In the rain it would not be the best.

One of my favourite attractions as a tourist in Sydney. When visiting Sydney as a toursit me and my boyfriend were tight on money and had heard mixed reviews about the Bridge climb so decided to do the pylon lookout which was a no brainer at $13! The walk up is quite tiring so bare this is mind but we found this trip soo interesting, make sure you read all the history and dont just walk passed it (it is very interesting) The view from the lookout is so good you are way higher up than you expect and can see everything just as much as if you did the bridge climb I am told. We did this on a very overcast day and think it would be even better on a sunny day, The film at the end is also worth staying for. Highly recommend! We stayed for at least an hour.

Fall in love with Sydney. With gorgeous weather, the view from the Pylon lookout is breathtaking -- 360 degrees from a solid lookout that topped with clear plexiglass. There are bench- height places to stand and walk along so you can get a great view no matter your height. For $13 and a moderate stair climb which is all internal, you can take your time to appreciate the view and stay as long as you like. My BF did the bridge climb, then met me here and we did the Pylon, he enjoyed both. Hardest part was finding the way to get there, Google is not accurate. The approach to the Pylon is far back at Argyle Steps - close to Argyle / Cumberland intersection. When you're close, there are signs. Then cross Cumberland (I think) and slightly left and go up another set of stairs which takes you to the bridge level. Give yourself time to find and walk there, it's further than it appears. Well worth the effort!
$13.80 well spent. Not quite the height of the Bridge Climb but you get amazing views of Sydney from on top of the Pylon plus you get the history of the bridge on the way up. Highly recommended

Great place to learn about the bridge and get the fabulous views!. While many people want to climb the bridge, climbing the pylon was good enough for us! There is an informative exhibit that goes along with the entrance fee to climb up. We had a gorgeous day and magnificent views - even had a couple getting married taking pictures up there!

Fuss free Bridge climb!. This is a quicker and much cheaper way of "climbing" the Harbour Bridge compared to BridgeClimb. Fantastic 360 degree view from the top pylon, easy and pleasant stroll up the steps through an interesting museum on the way there and not crowded! highly recommend to visitors and residents alike. Inexpensive ticket price, can bring the whole family in as part of walking over the bridge.
Most don't get to see. Most get to the Harbour Bridge yet not many know you get inside and climb up the inside of one of the pylons. A little museum about the bridge and a lookout up top.

Great View. If you are not up to climbing the bridge this is a great alternative with views of Sydney. The steps aren't that bad and if you can make the flights to the ticket booth you can easily make the top
Great View. This was well worth the $13 and 200 step climb to the top. The views were great and we took tons of pictures. Three is a short film that further details the history of the bridge.
Great Spot to View the Harbour. This is the best spot to get photos of the Sydney Opera House and the Harbour. We enjoyed the views, and getting some great photos.

Climb to an Icon. A cheaper alternative to Bridge Climb. Less money, less physical effort, but the same great 360- degree vantage of the harbour. About 200 stairs to climb, that everyone with a reasonable fitness can manage. Reaching the top you’re 86m above the sea level and with such a panoramic view, that you never will forget.Also on the way up there are 3 levels of exhibits, about the story of the construction of the bridge.
A nice view. It´s not too many stairs. And it gives you a different view of the Opera House and the Bridge. It´s worth it.

Lovely views and exhibit . Some may say the Pylon Lookout is a bit redundant as the view from the bridge is already nice, and while I see where they are coming from, I do not agree. Indeed the fences on the bridge make the views nice but... well, fenced. The Pylon allows for an unrestricted view over all of Sydney. The exhibit on the construction of the bridge is a nice added bonus as well! Could do with friendlier staff though. Both staff members I encountered were rude and looked like they would rather be swimming with sharks than working...PS: if a student, do not forget your student ID for a concession fare!
Fabulous!!!. How awesome is the view!!Not being up to physically climbing the bridge we decided to walk it.... then we found out that you can climb the pylon. Just fabulous!!

The bridge climb alternative. Having done this and the bridge climb back in 2005, I thought I would save money and do this again, definitely don't feel i missed anything out even though I remember the bridge climb being amazing. This is super value and you learn bits also. Great to be on part of the most iconic skyline in the world. Oh and the view is quite good too.

Excellent views!. The pylon (bridge support) is hollow and for €13 you can climb stairs up inside it till you reach viewing gallery at the top, 86 meters I think. The viewing gallery allows you to walk 360 and enjoy the views. It's not the adrenalin fuelled bridge span climb but it's very worth a look. It's over 200 steps to the top but has an exhibition explaining the whole history and engineering challenges faced by the builders on various levels as you ascend. It's fun, educational and good for all with a reasonable fitness level.

Climb the pylon and save some money. The Sydney Harbour Bridge Pylon is a great vantage point to see Sydney Harbour. If you are energetic and have some money to spend, you can do the Sydney Harbour climb, but the Pylon Lookout is less expensive. You will need to climb some stairs to reach the top of the Pylon, but anyone of average fitness should be able to manage it. The Pylon also has some exhibits along the way. By the way, you can walk across the Sydney Harbour Bridge gratis.
What a view!. Worth the hike and cost, the view from the top is breath-taking. Galleries of historic pictures depicting the building of the Harbour Bridge tell the story of its construction.

Great harbour views. I couldn't summon the courage to do the Bridge walk, however, this was the closest I could get to that and still feel comfortable. Bit of a climb, but worth it. Views were magnificent and I took lots of photos.

What a view. The views from the Pylon Lookout are just spectacular. The signs leading up to the Lookout are somewhat confusing. Thankfully, I had a map with directions from the tourist center by the harbor. It is very windy, so when taking pictures make sure your camera or phone is secure. On the way out is a short movie that you can watch, talking about the construction of the Harbor Bridge. It's well worth the stairs!

Pretty impressive views from the top. Upon request of a friend of mine, I have visited the pylon lookouts on a cloudy afternoon of the Sydney city. I have particularly enjoyed views from the pylons. I liked the impact of harbour bridge on the ocean of the Sydney. If you look another side, opera house seems to be standing so beautifully. Ticket for this is just 13$.

Impressive views. As part of a Sydney Harbour Bridge climb package I received 2 tickets for entry to the Pylon Lookout and on a Saturday morning took my wife and 16 year old son to the Lookout. It's a fascinating attraction with interesting displays describing the Bridge's planning and construction. I particularly enjoyed reading about the social aspects and the impact of the Bridge on Sydney. Reaching the Lookout requires climbing 200 steps, but this should be manageable for most and there are places to stop and rest if necessary. The views from the top are breathtaking. We were blessed with sunny weather and the views over the Harbour, Opera House, Circular Quay, the CBD and North and West Sydney were very nearly as spectacular as those from the top of the Bridge itself. In all we spent an hour climbing, viewing and reading about the bridge and that was time well-spent. At A$13 for entry this is great value for those who don't have the time or the cash to undertake the full Bridge Climb.

Fantastic alternative to the BridgeClimb.. While the BridgeClimb looks awesome, it is also super pricy at about $230 per adult. Our family of 4 was going to be over $900 and one of our little members was scared to do it, so over to the Pylon Lookout we went. It was an informative climb up, covering history of the bridge and a great vantage at top of the rest of the bridge and the city. Priced at only $14 per adult, we did the whole family for about $45. After, you can walk across the bridge for free!

Great brisk walk to an historic point with an almighty view. Once you reach the pylon your legs are ready for the 200 stair climb. Stops at many points to tell the story of the building of the bridge. Even toilets at the half way point.

stairs to a view. when you climb the stairs to get on to the Bridge you still have 200 more to climb the Pylon to the lookout. there is a $13 charge for adults. there are a few levels in side and a few seats, a bubblier (water) there is a museum (mini) all about how the bridge was built also a short movie higher up the Pylon there is a souvenir shop with toilets.at the top there is more to read about the bridge and one of the best views in Sydney looking over the Opera House, Sydney Harbor, the Bridge traffic and Bridge Climb, the City and the Quay. it is well worth the climb I have done it 3 times now and I will be back.
Great option to see the bridge. When with work colleagues. I'm a local who never knew about it. Lost cost quick option for seeing the bridge

Almost as good as the bridge walk.... Cheap with amazing views and a wonderful history of the bridge...it was fun walking up all those stairs and finding a vista that seemed to come out of nowhere...was not expecting it to be so good...$15 compared with 280 for the bridge walk.

Well worth it! Must do!. This is a lot better than going up the bridgeclimb as the price difference is HUGE to begin with and this offers great views of the city the opera house and the bridge all the same. Also have a good souvenir shop which is better than shopping in the city. I had read someones advice of doing a walk across the bridge and simply going up the pylon for the views and I'd say, stick to that (despite having personally done the bridgeclimb, its okay... not sure if worth the price you pay for it.. plus you cant click your own pics)

360 degree views. Forget the bridge climb and its astronomical price. At $13/ adult you can walk around at leisure and take all the photos and videos you like as well as watch the bridge climbers trudge up for $283 - it's a no brainer. Still at 87 m ( bridge is 134m).
Great Comprise for the view. Don't really like heights but wanted to get the birds eye view - this was it. Plus you get lots of info on the construction of the bridge.

Great Views. If you cannot afford the Bridge climb, or don't have the time, then definitely do the Pylon lookout and visit the museum. It is well worth the money and gives great views across the Harbour to the Opera House as well.

Absolutely worth it. I was having a tough time deciding whether to pony up the huge cash to climb the bridge, but the more I read TA reviews, the more I realized to save my money for other things and do the Pylon Lookout. It was $10 US compared with $224 US to climb it during the mid-day (even more money for sunset). The views from the Pylon were fantastic and inside the pylon there was great information on the building and history of the bridge. I strongly recommend doing this as opposed to the bridge climb. One thing to note though: the Pylon Lookout involves climbing 10 sets of stairs, so be ready, however, there are bench rests and the stairs are quite roomy.

Great visuals but doesn't beat the Bridge Climb. Seeing all of Sydney from a top of the Pylon look out is pretty cool and some will say it will save you a fortune instead of doing the bridge climb. However, after doing both, I gotta say this has nothing on the climb itself ( and its sooo worth the money).
Sydney Harbour's little treasure. Great history, a good walk up and AMAZING views at a bargain basement price! Why do the bridge climb?

Come here if you've got tickets from Bridge Climb, otherwise it's a bit of a bust. The view here isn't bad. Actually, the Pylon in the bridge is a facade. In that, when the bridge was originally built, they didn't think people would feel the bridge was secure without the Pylon area. Prepare for a bit of stair climbing, and the actual look out is very small. You get a great view but if it's a busy day, well...you'll be crowded.

Fantastic view without the price tag. Most people don't seem to know about this place but instead of doing the bridge climb you can just go up one of the Pylons. The views are fantastic, almost as good as if you went up the bridge itself. Nice little shop and some great exercise. Good for kids and adults. Well worth the visit

Fantastic View. I was recently able to visit the top of the Sydney Harbour Bridge Pylon and the view was stunning! It was cheap and besides the view had a fantastic museum. I was able to take these stunning shots of our beautiful city.

Pylon lookout. Had read the many great reviews of the pylon lookout and it lived up to them. Was only about 200 stairs to the top and the view was certainly worth it. Is I think you are about 89m above sea level at the lookout. Also worth reading the history of the bridge and the making also, really interesting and the short film that you can sit and watch on the way out is also really good. I went with my 12 and 14 year old and I would say would suit all ages young and old.Prob not quite the same as the bridge climb itseslf but for the cost definately an alternative.

Harbour bridge pylon lookout. As we have to do Sydney on a budget, we were very disappointed at the exorbitant cost of climbing the bridge. For a family of four it is unaffordable. I heard about the pylon climb, but there was not much information. However, plan to walk across the bridge and you will easily come across the pylon climb for 13 aus dollars! Still expensive for us, but more affordable than the climb. Beautiful views of Sydney from the pylon.

Great views. We were in Sydney for a long week-end from Brisbane where we live, and were going to undertake the Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb (and we did).But we also thought that we would climb up to the Pylon Lookout as it was such a nice day, having never been up there before.It was well worth it - the views over Sydney Harbour, the Sydney Opera House, the city CBD and it's skyscrapers, and the Sydney Harbour Bridge, were brilliant.Don't miss it! Five stars!

Great Views. From the top of the pylon you can get excellent views of the opera house and Sydney harbour so if you're wanting a photo of the city try here. You also look straight up the outer arch of the bridge and can see bridge climbers doing their climb. When you do a Bridgeclimb you are given a free entry to the pylon (if you haven't climbed too many steps already ) There are displays of early Sydney in the pylon as well as a shop to get souvenirs.

Adds to your understanding of Sydney. Having done Bridge Climb - we had a free entry ticket to the Pylon. It was worth the short walk up the Bridge from the Rocks and had excellent views. Quite some effort has gone into the displays and the history of the bridge video is the best I have seen. all helps you get a much better feel for Sydney and the importance of the Bridge to many spheres of life. Great views of the surrounds and pointers on the viewing terraces give loads of location references. Harbour, Opera House, Kiribilli, Darling Harbour, Barangaroo and Bridge Climbers all well viewed from here.
Alternate harbour bridge climb. Not as strenuous or spectacular or scary (if you don't like heights) as the Bridge climb, but well worth the effort.

A Hidden Treasure!. Our taxi driver told us about this gem of an attraction! We walked from our hotel in York Street up to the South West(?) pylon and for $13 each we had a wonderful experience. The stairs were not a problem and the views and photographic opportunities were excellent. We looked at their various static displays and saw people doing the Bridge climb. This is about half as high at less than a tenth of the price and you can take as many photos as you wish. With the money saved on the climb, we took a helicopter flight over the harbour. Do your self a favour and try this activity!

I'll be back. After a most enjoyable walk across the Sydney Harbour bridge we decided to go up to the Sydney Pylon Lookout. I was a little concerned about climbing all those stairs but managed it quite well. You can stop and rest if it's not too busy at the different levels. A most worthwhile experience to learn about the History of the bridge. Adult tickets are $13 and $6.50 From there we went to the Rocks for lunch. A great day out.

Great views. If you are short on time or do not want to spend the money on the bridge climb then this is a great alternative. It cost $13 to do the Pylon climb which is great value for money, you get fantastic views of the bridge, the harbour and the Opera House from the top.

Must see lookout. Pylon lookout provide a unique way to look at the beautiful Sydney Harbor, you get to see the bridge so close and the panoramic view of Harbor and Opera House. It’s also a good to see the history of the bridge and some old photos.Don’t miss this…

Great value for being almost on top of the Sydney Harbour Bridge. I used to go to school in Sydney many years ago and a mate of mine had invited me to climb to the top of the Harbour Bridge on occasions. He had figured a way to get to the top of the arch. The thought of getting caught had always stopped me from joining him. I have kind of regretted it many years later so I was determined to do the "Walk Over the Harbour Bridge" tour on my recent return trip in April. I then found out how much it costs. My local friends recommended a great alternative - the Pylon Lookout. For $13 AUS each, my wife and I enjoyed a breathtaking view of the Sydney Harbour, the Opera House and watched a plane sprayed "Marry Me" in the sky. (No name was sprayed though so anyone can take credit)The Pylon Lookout also has a museum within that provided a great narrative on the genesis of the Harbour Bridge project. As it turned out the 4 pylons were not structural significant but the Chief Engineer insisted on constructing them as he had the vision that these structures would add major aesthetic to the future icon of this wonderful city.Coming from the Cumberland Street you will have to climb a few set of stairs to get to the east side of the bridge walkway which leads you to the base of the Lookout. Once you reach the Pylon you will have to climb more stairs. But I think it is all very worth while.

Affordable Vista. Had this on my bucket list for a while, so glad I finally got to visit this site on a beautiful sunny winter's day and the view was amazing, you could take your time to soak in this beautiful city, lots of pictures taken. Well worth the admission of $13 for adult $8.50 concession. Also had a museum and historical information + a guide on top of lookout was there to answer any questions.
Great View at cheaper Price !. This is a great place to have the 360 city view with a fraction of a price compare to the skyPoint climb. Go before they close to get a almost sunset view.

Cheaper than bridge climb. If you don't want to shell out $200 or more to climb the bridge, this is a nice alternative. Cost around $11. Often quite windy being so high up and on the harbour. Sunset would be great time for extrordinary views.

Its nice to do it. If you are Walking over the Harbour Bridge you can go on one of the pylons to have a great view over the Skyline from Sydney. It costs 13$ for a adult and i think ist worth. If you want to have a nice photo from the Harbour go up there and take some. Also there is a lot of stuff to see inside about the history and the build up from the Bridge wich is very interesting to see.

Awesome view and great alternative to the Bridge Climb.. I had wanted to do the Bridge Climb since some friends had completed it but hadn't realized how expensive it was - especially if you want to go at a popular time -- upwards to $300. A colleague mentioned doing the Pylon lookout -- as the view was almost as good, took much less time, you could take all the pictures you want (you can't take your own camera on the Bridge Climb) and it was only $13. We went on a beautiful day and it was breathtaking! So worth the trip! You have to go up about 200 steps but it was not very difficult -- there were breaks/etc. every 60 steps or so.

Beautiful view. We got a admission for the lookout included in our Harbour Bridge Climb ticket. So we went the day after. Beautiful view! So many amazing pictures! Well worth it. We were lucky that it wasn't very busy when we went (late morning). As we were leaving and walking on the bridge, there was a tourist group that had just walked off their cruise boat, on their way to see it. Probably 60-80 people. It would be awful to be up there and have this huge group of tourists invade. So luckily that wasn't our experience.

Great Views and a perfect price. Small museum as you walk up to the top. Very informative and easy to read. Views are stunning and you walk around the full viewing area getting 360 degree view. Excellent value for money.

Stunning Views!!. If you don't do the Bridge Climb on the Sydney Harbour Bridge, but want to get pretty much the same views as those who do the Climb, head for the lesser known Lookout at the first pylon on the Bridge. It's not that easy to find the pathway to the pylon, but well worth the effort. For around $10, you get to climb about 200 steps to the observation deck, about 285' above the water, for 360º views of the Sydney Harbor and the city skyline. From the pylon you can even watch the climbers as they make their way to the top of the Bridge arch. On the way up to the observation deck, there are 3 levels of exhibits where you will discover the history and construction of the Bridge. Definitely worth a visit.

Sydney's best kept secret. Don't tell everyone about this. The pylon lookout is an amazing place for photographs.Just remember to keep a strap on the camera. Even a Canon won't survive a fall from this height.For old folks for me, it's quite a climb to the top. You need to pay a small fee, but this is a miniscule amount considering the view.

What a view. WoW the view the history of the bridge. Such a interesting piece of history and to see and listen to the stories. Sure enjoyed the stories of the cats that lived on the bridge along with there owner.

Great view from the Lookout. We came here as we were not doing the bridge climb. We have to climb some steps before we can see the lookout signage. As we entered, we have to pay the entrance fees. For my 2 daughters who are still students, we get to pay student rates. There were some statutes showing how the workers build the great bridge. It was really dangerous. As we climb the steps, there are benches for us to rest. There are also water cooler, gift shops etc. Once we reached the top, there are signages explaining the logistics of this bridge which give us more knowledge and information the 200 steps were not that bad for us. We enjoyed the spectacular view of the differnt places including a close view of the bridge. As we were quite early, so we did not get to see anybody doing the bridge climb. We took some pictures and multiple videos. Good place to visit.
Free and an awesome Harbour view.. Definitely worth visiting on a nice day. Offers spectacular harbour views and is free! Quite a few stairs but well worth it.
Cheaper than the bridge climb. Cheaper than the bridge climb and great views of the city plus a good view of the bridge ! Plus you can take pictures on your camera unlike walking over the bridge

Magnificent views. Magnificent views of Sydney. A bit of climb at a fraction of the price to climb the Sydney Bridge and you get to use your camera on this one. Well worth the $14 (compare to the $200+ for the other one) I recommend this as a must-do when in Sydney.

Good Views.. A bit of a climb up the stairs inside but well worth the effort on reaching the top. Not only a good view of the circular quay area of the harbour but also an ideal spot for watching the bridge climbers starting out on their climb

Great views at your pace. Before heading to Sydney I always wanted to hike the Sydney Harbor Bridge, but after reading the Trip Advisor reviews I learned of the Pylon Lookout. I'm so glad to have done this instead of the overpriced hike. You can climb almost as high as the top of the bridge, but you can take as many pictures as you want from the viewing platform. You can also take as long as you want as well. You don't waste hours getting geared up and waiting in a line. Plus it's only $14 and worth it. There is a movie and exhibits inside the pylon as well. I'd highly recommend this instead of the bridge climb unless you like spending lots of money and have lots of time to waste in Sydney.
Good views cheaper than the bridge climb. If you don't want to spend the money on the Sydney Bridge Climb I recommend doing this. You get some lovely photos that you can take yourself

Awesome View. If you cannot afford to do the bridge climb , I would defiantly do the Pylon Lookout. Its at 3 Cumberland st , Rocks. Its located in south east pylon of the bridge. We walked the Street above Circular Quay along the Cahill expressway . What a lovely walk. Entry cost us $ 13 adults concession $ 8.50 kids $ 6.50 & under 4 free. Well worth the view. The climb up the stairs to the museum didn't take to long about 10 minutes . There are 200 stairs & 87 metres above sea level. Its opened 7 days 10 am - 5pm . There are 3 levels of exhibits & a open air section for lovely photos. Theres a lot of history & the construction of the bridge .There are toilets on one of the levels . Remember to take you camera

Vacation. Everytime I see Australia, they show Harbor Bridge and Opera House. Try to cross the bridge on food, it's amazing experience. When I see the bridge fireworks on new year's eve, Oh!, yes, I cross one end to the other side of the bridge, proud of myself, just like I did on Golden Gate Bridge in San Francisco.
Nice experience and beautiful views. We did the Bridge Climb 2 weeks prior to the Pylon Lookout. The Pylon Lookout and Bridge Museum are complement to the experience.

Great views. Not as adventurous as the full bridge climb but certainly a much cheaper alternative. Views of the city and the harbour are just as spectacular and you can use your own camera.Not an overly extensive display of the bridge's history but overall well worth the visit. Good experience also walking on the Bridge's pedestrian walkway.

Only for the brave. We did not do this as we were not brave enough. We watched from the ground people walking up and over the bridge they looked like tiny ants. Those that did it said it was wonderful

Very interesting!. Made the climb with my three children, they loved the views and found the information very interesting.We all learnt a lot on our visit and would recommend this attraction to others. We found the directions a little difficult if you didn't know the area as we were unsure which level to get off the staircase at on the way.

Great views of the harbour. If you don't want to spend $300+ for the Bridge Climb Experience, spend about $20 and climb the Pylon lookout instead. It was a little tricky to find the entrance. We had to ask the folks at the Bridge Climb experience for directions. You can read up on some of the history of the bridge, watch a short video, and enjoy the views from the top of the pylon. If you are lucky, you'll also be able to watch the Bridge Climb folks making their ascent. This is a fantastic, inexpensive way to get some amazing views of the harbor.

Awesome Views.. Found this by accident whilst walking the Bridge last time in Sydney, half the height of the Actual Bridge Climb, spectacular views of the Harbour for a small fee, just have to like steps!

Comes included with your Bridge Climb Ticket ~ Take Your Camera. I forget to mention on my review of the Bridge Walk that your ticket also includes the price to go to the top of the Pylon. You can take you camera, so we got some great photographs of the Sydney harbor, the Bridge, The Opera House, etc. Climb 200 stairs inside the South-East Pylon to the Pylon Lookout for sweeping views of the World Heritage Listed Sydney Opera House and Harbor surrounds. The Bridge’s four pylons are primarily aesthetic. It took 250 Australian, Scottish and Irish stonemasons to prepare the granite for them. Now home to the Pylon Lookout Museum, the South-East Pylon has been open to the public since 1934. The Museum contains a comprehensive collection of displays that celebrate the construction of the Bridge.

I reembered doing this as a kid - had to do it again when it re-opened. Everything was smaller than I remembered, but the view from the top is one of the Must Do things if you are bringing visitors to Sydney. The memorabililla on the way up the pylon is interesting and the view only wants to entice you to take a Harbour Bridge climb !

Great Views of the Harbour. Great Views of the harbour for those of us that think the bridge climb is too expensive.Worth the price < $20 because you get unobstructed Views. It can be hard to take unobstructed pictures from the bridge deck.Also you get to learn some history and learn about the engineering and construction of the bridge.I was born and lived here for 20 years - well worth the price to do once.
Well worth the small charge. Walk the bridge and then climb the tower for even more spectacular views of the harbour and Opera House. Go for it.

Great view!. We had been living in Sydney for 10 months before we finally got up to the lookout! We went on Australia day, it was brilliant, the weather was great and there was lots to look at in the harbour. There's also things to read and look at on the way up...and lots of stairs - not sure if there's a lift.The stairs are worth it though - what a view!

Best view of Sydney. I would definitely recommend the Pylon lookout, well worth the money to see the best views of Sydney. The pictures up here are much better than ground level. We were lucky enough to go on a clear day, and it was just breath-taking.
Nice views. lots of tourists, but nice alternative to the bridge climb , you get to see the city from above including the harbour which is really pretty

nice views. I went there couple of days after climbing a Harbour Bridge, but this tours should be taken together, since in the Pylon there is a lot of very interesting information about the bridge. The view from the pylon is really great, I made quite a few of good photos.

Best view. This place has the best view of the Bridge and the Opera House. There are restaurants along side of the Lookout. You can get better view if you go up to the top of the cruise ship terminal. The view is breath-taking. Sit there and enjoy the view and soak in the sun. Lovely place.

Great city view from here. For those afraid of doing the bridge climb, this is a great alternative although you really don't get the view you do on the bridge climb. Take the bridge stairs up from Cumberland Street in the Rocks and then go to the pylon itself where you can enter after paying the admission charge. Lots of stairs to climb though. Good historical photos and outstanding explanation of the building of the bridge inside the pylon as you climb up to the top level.

Well worth a visit. We had this included as part of our ticket for the Bridge Climb. It is well worth a visit as it gives you some excellent views and some history along the way. Be aware that there are quite a lot of stairs to climb!

Great views at a fraction of the price.. On the bridge climb you cannot take your camera but here you can and the views are worth the climb of 200 plus steps.We climbed the tower as part of our walk across the bridge on the road levek footway. The entrance paydesk us a couple of flights up...made us wonder...and there are concession rates. Far cheaper than the bridge climb and I do not think the views are any different. Plus grear views of the bridge arch. Grear attraction and great views. Another of the "must do's" when in Sydney at $13.

Worth the climb. Visited with my mum and sister.200 steps but worth the climb.Views from the top are spectacular. You can see Darling Harbour, Sydney Harbour, Circular Quay and beyond. Fantastic views of the Opera House.The display explaining the construction and design was informative and very interesting. Make time for the slide show/ presentation on the 1st floor on way out. There is a drinking fountain part-way up the 2ndset of stairs. A souvenir shop and further display on the 2nd floor. A final display on the 3rd floor. The first set of stairs are the steepest, but have benches at the top of each flight if you need to rest.

Why do BridgeClimb when you can climb this?. Seriously it only cost $13 for an adult to climb to the Pylon Lookout and you get similar views as from the Bridgeclimb. Plus you're allowed to bring your own camera on this climb and you can chill up on the viewing deck for as long as you want. Go on a clear sunny day and the views are incredible.

Great views, history, full bridge experience. Foot problems caused us to cancel the planned Bridge Climb, but we ended up very glad to have done Pylon instead. One gets to walk to it via the walk alongside the Bridge - feeling traffic, etc. and the full size and geometry of the bridge itself. 3 flights of steps up to display and lookout levels provide self-paced history displays, very low key but well done. The 360 view from the open air top level was perfect for sights and photos. Clean WCs. Completely enjoyed. Inside the pylon was very hot the day we were there, 200 steps, but the fresh air provides relief.
A must do!. Being able to see the whole Sydney from this lookout point was awesome. Took lots of great picture. Very nice experience.
Worth the climb. Entrance fee is $13.00 for adults, good value. Lots to see and read if you are interested in the history of the building of Harbour Bridge. Great views from the top of the Pylon.

Great views and a lot cheaper than the bridge walk. I was planning to do the bridge walk but found that cameras and phones are not allowed plus, it was eye wateringly expensive so, decided to go up the Pylon for 13 oz dollars. Other than the view not a great deal to see but, great view and not significantly lower than the bridge.Do it if you want views and photos on a budget

So worth it!. After getting ourselves lost, on a very warm day, we got half way there and contemplated turning back......so glad we didn't! I cannot recommend this enough. The steps up are manageable, with a drinking fountain half way up and plenty of information boards to read. A small shop and toilets at half way, allow you to take a break if needed. Once up the top you are greeted by the most amazing views of Sydney! We spent an hour taking the most amazing pics and soaking up the scenery in all it's glory!

Amazing view and good value. One day we will do the bridge climb, but for the five of us, it would be quite expensive. We decided to walk across the bridge on a stunning autumn day and we found the pylon museum, which I had only heard of a day or so before ( despite being a regular visitor to Sydney and one time resident).Cost from memory was $13 for adults, $8.50 for teenagers and $6.50 for kids, kids under four for free.200 stairs to the top, so some reasonable fitness is needed.The Views are just breathtaking, 360degrees with clever faint writing on the glass, pointing out landmarks.The museum was informative. We all enjoyed it! It is easy to find, just walk over the bridge and it is on the walkway.

Brilliant value but I still wanted to walk the actual bridge. Backpacking on a budget. Climb the pylon think it's $15 you get an awesome view but you don't go as high as the bridge climbers. The bridge climbs were fully booked so book in advance. The days are hot so plan well. If your not great with heights just do the pylon for a fraction of the price.

Good views at top. We had tickets to go to the pylon which were included with our bridge climb experience. Lots of stairs to get to the top of pylon especially if you have just done the bridge walk. But one you get to the top their are great views. There is also a lot history regarding the building of the bridge. Would recommend if visiting Sydney.

Great Views. We received free entry to this attraction as part of our Bridge Climb experience. This was our chance to take photos of the harbour and Sydney as we were unable to take our camera on the Bridge Climb.

Great views; great price. This is a great way to get city/harbor/opera views and at a reasonable cost. The bridge climb surely gets great views, but is also very expensive and takes a long time. It's an easy walk from the Rocks/ferry area and a great addition to your stroll around the city.

Great view on a budget. Want an awesome view without spending a fortune? This is it. Easy to access and is even a nice walk up and back from the pylon. In fact Id recommend you continue across the bridge once you are done and jump on the train at Millers POint on the other side to come back.
Must do !!. A nice walk for beautiful views on the Sydney bay. Access is free from the south side ( bridge stairs or cahill elevated walkway). Take your time to enjoy....

Must do on day 1 of your Sydney visit. It's a walk to get here, but, the views ... Very worth the visit. You can get some of your best pictures of the trip. If you've never been to Sydney you should do this either before or after your bridge climb.

Good to check in. Well...the bridge walk may be too expensive and you cannot take your camera up there. Better go up on a Pylon Lookout on a sunny day! It costs 14 AUD and well...good to spend some time. You'll see a little bit of how the bridge was built and some facts. You can get a good close up selfie with the Habour Bridge and good selfie with the Opera House up there.

Beautiful view, worth the stairs! . After getting walking around in circles and getting lost looking for the entrance to the bridge, I finally found it! It was a short walk on the bridge to the lookout and an adult admission price is 13AUD. In my opinion, the view on top was worth the price and all the steps going to the stairs. I went around and took a lot of photos. It was also a nice sunny day which made it even better.

Awesome Views!. We weren't up for climbing to the top of the bridge, but this was the next best thing. PLUS, you can take your camera up the pylon which you can't do on the climb.We were already exhausted from all the walking, but we managed to make it to the top of the pylon and we are so glad we did. The views are incredible and you can spend all the time you want up there. Also, there is lots of information and exhibits on how the bridge was conceived and built...very interesting! And at the end there is a ten minute movie with pictures of the bridge throughout its history.They have a senior discount but even at full price this is worth it!
Great views. Only a couple of hundred steps to great 360 views of Sydney Harbour. There is also a museum with lots of info about the building of the Sydney Harbour Bridge.
Fantastic view. Lots of stairs to get to the top, but it's inside under cover and there's no rush, the view is worth it, it's quite high up, next best thing to the bridge climb without the expense!
Do it!. Spend $10 AUD and climb to the top. You can stay as long as you like...the views are unbelievable 360 degrees!

Great spot to see Sydney from. Great views and an awesome spot to look around Sydney harbour. Easy walk to The Rocks and the markets. Exploring the walkway below around the point is also very relaxing.

Great views, great museum. This is well worth a visit. For a small fraction of the cost of the bridge walk, you get a very interesting exhibition of the history of the bridge (including a short film) and some spectacular views from the top of the pylon. It's a good few steps up to the top but you are rewarded by the views.

A view worth walking for!. The view from the Pylon Lookout is spectacular! To be fair, we haven't taken the walk across the top of the harbour bridge and are sure that that would be a spectacular view. That said, the pylon wasn't too bad!It is easily accessible after a walk through the Rocks market. Entrance into the pylon also includes some displays and a video about the history about the construction of the bridge. It is comprehensive and informative.For those who wish to have an more affordable way to see the beautiful harbour from above, but don't want to pay for the bridge walk. Definitely visit the Pylon Lookout! You won't be disappointed.Also, the Pylon Lookout is mostly indoors. With the exception of the peak (includes an outdoor area) and the walk up to the Pylon. A total of 200 steps I believe, to reach the peak.
Hi Py. Instead of 100's of dollars why not a few? !/3 of the way up the Bridge Climb for a fraction of the price.

Great view and interesting history. I was not brave enough to go over the top of the bridge on the bridge walk, but from the pylon lookout you get a great view of those people who are! The views over the harbour are wide and you can see how big the harbour really is. Inside there are displays showing the history of the bridge and its building. They were comprehensive and interesting.

Just as good a view and a fraction of the price of the bridge walk.. I was tempted to try the bridge walk over the arch until I saw the prices. Well over $300 for the opportunity to climb over the bridge seemed very steep (and I don't mean the climb, I mean the price). So I instead walked out on the bridge to the South Pylon and paid $13 to climb up to the lookout point at the top. The view is spectacular, and for the price, a considerable value. There is also bridge information inside the pylon and a short movie reviewing the history of the bridge. The pylon does close in the early evening, so you won't get a chance to see the sunset, or go up at night, but for the cost difference, I thought it was the better value.

Don't miss this opportunity for great views of the city & learn the history of the bridge. We decided to walk the bridge following useful information given to us by the tour guide on the free walking tour we had enjoyed earlier that day. We were not aware of the Pylon Lookout and were so glad we had the opportunity to climb to the top for superb views of the harbour/city and beyond. As "seniors" it was a very reasonable 8.50 dollars per person to climb to the top of the pylon. En route to the top there is a very interesting exhibition outlining the history of how the bridge was built. Don't miss this opportunity to learn the history of the bridge and enjoy panoramic views.
Brilliant unexpected treat. This is a must. Great value. The pylon displays the history of the tower, nice film show at the end. Fantastic views of the bay.

An underrated Sydney attraction. I am a local to Sydney and always recommend the Sydney Harbour Bridge's South Pylon as a place to visit. The views are brilliant and the info on the Bridge build and local history is excellent. Nice to walk up after a visit to the markets in The Rocks. A great alternative view and if you want a drink is Blu Bar on 36 at Shangri-La, but this one is better at sunset.

Great views of the bridge. I enjoyed my visit to the Pylon Lookout as it gave me the opportunity to see the bridge from close by and photograph those people climbing over the bridge. I learned the facts and figures of the bridge and thought it was very interesting.
Great views. Excellent views of the bridge and harbour, also plenty of information about the construction of the bridge.
Great way to see the bridge. The Pylon is a great way to see the bridge and Sydney without breaking the bank! Well worth the stairs and just great views of the city

Great camera views. This doesn't seem to be that well publicised, but it affords great views of Sydney particularly Opera House, Circular Quay and the City. The cost was about $8 per adult. The beauty of it is you can get outside and take photos from 360 degrees. You can't take a camera on the Bridge walk and it's way cheaper for those on a budget.
ok but the climb is better. the pylon visit is ok and a great way for those who do not want to climb to see the bridge, there are lots of steps to climb after walking to the pylon

Excellent view on the bay and the opera house. Very nice view of the opera house and on the Sydney bay! You can see 360 degrees around to take some good pictures. You can also see the climbers of the bridge go up and down. There's some information signs on the inside about the building of the bridge, and a short video that shows more of what it looked like when it was being built. Cheap, for a good view!

Fantastic view - and it's free!!!. I'd suggest doing a walk through the historic area of the Rocks and then climb the steps to the top of the pylon. Amazing views down the Harbour and over the Opera House. Great walk and area and lots of fun if you go exploring. My best suggestion is to do a morning walk except late Autumn and early Spring (can vary) as you Oz has late clouds roll in. Try and avoid morning fog and afternoon cloud cover.

Good Vantage point to see the Sydney Harbour & Opera House. Be prepared to walk some stairs but you shall be rewarded with some spectacular Sydney harbour views and of the opera house. A great walk from the rocks area. Also for pictures and selfies.
Bit of a climb but great views. Nice stop to have a look at the view and harbor. pleasant walk from North Sydney and opportunity to take a ferry back. A few stairs but worth the climb.
INCREDIBLE views of the city!. This place give you amazing views of the opera house, the bridge itself and Sydney's Skyline.No elevators... so it is quite a walk to the top, but totally worth it.

Best view of the bridge, harbour, rocks area and opera house.. It was definitely worth climbing all those stairs! The view from the top was breath taking and we'll worth the walk to get there. Also interesting bits and pieces of information on the way up, especially liked the history of the bridge. Incredible watching the traffic and trains on the bridge and the ferries on the water. Our best experience of our visit to Sydney.

no lines and quit a veiw. The bridge climb requires planning and long waits the pylon can be done as a spur of the moment thing just a short walk halfway across the bridge and 200 steps and you're there

A vision of the Bridge as it once was. The Pylon Lookout at the Sydney Harbour Bridge has to have one of the best views in Sydney. It's a 200-stair climb to the lookout but the 360 degree view over Sydney, including the Opera House, is your reward. I first made he climb decades ago and I have done so again whenever I have the chance. You can follow up by taking the footpath to the other side of the Bridge, it takes around 15 or 20 minutes. In the levels leading to the Lookout, you can see how the Bridge was constructed, step by step. It's truly a vision of times gone by. A charge is levied, but it is quite reasonable..
Well worth the walk. Great views and if you are feeling energetic you won't be disappointed. Make sure you take a hat and some water with you.

Great viewing spot. There are quite a lot of steps involved (to reach the pylon from the Rocks area and then in the pylon itself) but this is a great spot for views of the bridge, opera house and harbour. It's also considerably cheaper than a bridge walk and you get almost as high with more solid walls around you.The exhibition information is good too, giving some context and key facts without being too much to take in.They also have a shop, toilets and free drinking fountain.

An inexpensive alternative to the bridge climb. I have done this several times with overseas visitors and they have all been wowed by the visit. There are great 360 deg. views, usually not too busy and you do not need to book in advance

A great insight as to how the Bridge was built.. The historical display on building the Bridge was well presented. Climbing the interior to the top is well worth the view. It's an alternative to climbing the bridge if heights are not your thing.

Can't afford the bridge climb then do this!. This is a must especially if you can't afford to do the bridge climb. Great views of the harbour and brilliant history of Sydney and the building of this Australian Icon.

Great experience. I think this is a great alternative to people who can't afford the bridge climb and in actual fact the view is identical... The price is very cheap less then 15 per head . Great for travellers ..lovers .. Or anyone who wants to see the city from above .
Good view.. This is the cheaper option than climbing the bridge and the view is just as good. Just need energy for alol the steps but worth the effort.

Pylon Lookout Fantastic Views.. Fantastic views of Sydney from the top of the lookout. Very interesting and informative to learn about the planning, building and the structure of the Harbour Bridge. Well worth a visit.
Views and history. Never knew this was there......Fantastic experience plenty of history and information within the Pylon then the views......Wow!!! An absolute must.

Put the city and harbour under your feet. A wonderful and no obstruction 360 degree view of the city and harbour can be see over here. Need to take the bus to Miller's point first, then take a few walks to the entrance to the pylon on Cumberland Street then walk along the sidewalk of the bridge for around 10 minutes then reach the pylon. Climb up the pylon you will see everything is so beautiful and it's worthwhile -- The trains, traffics, Opera house, harbour, bridge climber, etc.

High point in Sydney. We pondered about doing the Bridge Climb and visited this instead.Why spend a fortune being terrified in an overall on a scorching day of when it is raining!! The Pylon gave us a great perspective and we could wave to the Bridge Climbers too! Good exercise to get to the top but you can spend ages on each side and enjoy the history in the museum. NOT TO BE MISSED.

Closest thing to bridge climb. The Pylon outlook is also home to a museum. For $20 you get to visit the museum and 360degree views of Sydney and surrounds. Fraction of the cost. Fraction of the time and interesting history. Camera, binoculars, sunnies and hat.

Almost As Good As Bridge Climb At A Fraction Of Cost. Hint: There's no substitute for climbing the Sydney Harbor Bridge, but if you sign up for that, your bridge climb ticket includes admission to the pylon lookout. Check into your climb a day early, or at least two hours before your scheduled climb to go up the pylon lookout. You'll get 80% of the height of the climb. Nothing is as exhilarating as the climb itself, but you can take your camera with you to the pylon, where you can't on the climb for safety reasons. No elevator; you have over 200 steps to get up the pylon, but the view is well worth it.
Good views of Harbour Bridge, Opera House and CBD. Tickets came as part of Bridge Climb package and gave an excellent preview. Can use your own camera unlike the climb.
Awesome sights. Wow what a Brillant way to see Sydney Harbour top spot recommended great pictures too take your Joggers and comfy closes
Great views, don't climb on a hot day !. Lots of steps and quite hard to find, but a great view from top if you make it. Don't climb on a hot day ! Lots of history to look at whilst climbing
fantastic views. take some fluids and a camera and be prepared for a hike up the stairs and across the bridge, wear sunscreen and a hat. BUT the view is definitely worth it

Spectacular views. We got free pass having done Bridge Climb. However worth $13 to wander through the museum and then take in the fantastic views from the top.
Much better than the Opera House Tour. Come here and look at SOH from across the bay instead of wasting $37 on the tour!

Much cheaper option than the Bridge climb.. Was visiting Sydney with friends from England. They were thinking about doing the Bridge Climb, but were concerned with the price and amount of steps. As a much cheaper option, and more control over the speed you take the stairs, the Pylon Lookout is a very suitable option. The views are nearly as good, and you are able to take your own camera & phone so you can take your own photos, and you decide how long you want to stay.The day we visited was a little overcast and rain was threatening, so seemed like we had made a good choice. The views were great, as usual, with great vistas to the headlands, Circular Quay, Opera House, Darling Harbour, and many other areas.All for the huge cost of AUD $13. We stayed about an hour and watched the film about the construction of the Bridge, read the information & visited the souvenir shop. Our friends from the UK were very impressed and more than happy with the experience.Would highly recommend this for those who have minor mobility issues or are not able to afford the more expensive option of the Bridge Climb.

Bargain views of the city + great history. For such a great price it is well worth visiting. There are quite a few steps though!We took the train to Milsons Point, and then walked back along the bridge to the Pylon (it's the Pylon closest to The Rocks). Great views of the Harbour and a fascinating exhibit about the history of the bridge.
Nice. The view is much better than the ground or boat. And they have a little space to let you put your DLSR camera on. Which is so sweet!!!

Cheaper then the Bridge Climb. Accessed from the Harbour Bridge walkway (look for the Bridge Stairs off Cumberland Street near Gloucester Street). Great views of the city, Circular Quay and Sydney Harbour for those on a budget (the Bridge Climb is quite expensive).

Cheaper than a bridge climb. This is a great place to view the opera house and see the harbour from higher. It contains a museum that covers the building of the bridge and its history. I love this place and like to visit with anyone who is in Sydney that doesn't have the time to do a bridge climb. It is on the south end of the bridge and easy to access.
Why pay for the Bridgeclimb when you have this. This is a much cheaper option to doing the bridge climb. The view is great and there was no waiting to do it.

One of the Must Do attractions in Sydney. For a fraction of the cost of Bridgeclimb, you get great 360 degree views of the harbour and surrounds. This is on the compulsory list of attractions for my overseas visitors.
Token entry fee for great view of Sydney Harbour. The Pylon museum is a small museum and is OK. However, the main drawcard is getting up high at Sydney Harbour to see the amazing view.

Exquisite views of an iconic landmark! Must see!. I took a leisurely stroll from Milsons Point station across the bridge and paused at the Pylon Lookout for a good few minutes to drink in the scene and take a few pics - I can't imagine a better vantage point to take a photo of the Opera House.

Great views, incredible history - SEE MY TIPS!. For an inexpensive and magnificent 360 degree view of Sydney CBD, harbour and surrounds as well as a history lesson on the Bridge ... go to the Sydney Harbour Bridge Pylon Lookout and Museum. Watch the ferries, yachts, boats, ships and water taxis on the harbour; the cars, trucks, buses and trains on the bridge; and helicopters, seaplanes and jets in the air .... without feeling rushed or being pushed on by a tour operator. Tips: - there's about 15 flights of stairs (about 200 steps) to the top so take care - it's not recommended for frail people or very young children- there are several stops on the way up where you can catch your breath- there aren't any elevators or escalators- the payment desk is after about 10 flights of stairs- there are toilets in the gift shop area, which is the next floor up from the payment desk- you can take cameras out on the outdoor observation deck- there are no coin-operated binoculars on the observation deck so if you want a really good view, bring your own binoculars- the video presentation in the museum is on loop and goes for about 5-6 minutes and is highly recommended- the museum exhibits and information are fascinating and are highly recommended- go early to avoid school groups - but regardless, it didn't seem to get that busy- give yourself at least an hour and a half to absorb the views and take in all of the museum exhibits- no need to book in advance- we went on a sunny day but I'd say that rain, hail, thunder or shine, the view would be absolutely magnificent
Wow. We did the 200 steps up the Pylon lookout and it was well worth it. Great view, lots of information available and very helpful staff.

For only $13 and a little energy for a birds eye view of Sydney Harbour and Opera House.. For only $13 climb 200 steps of the pylon for stunning views of Sydney harbour, Opera House and the greater Sydney. The history of the building of the bridge is wonderful as is the photos and museum. Definitely worth it if you are not going to do the Bridgeclimb.

Great harbour bridge and city views. I took some visitors here and they loved it !!! They had not realized they could do it without signing up for the very expensive arch walk. He had a minor fear of heights but managed fine. It is a great way to see the bridge at a reasonable cost ($13 adult, $8.50 seniors, $6.50 kids). There are some museum related items and historical overviews on the way up, but not heaps. There is also a large screen movie showing how the bridge has changed over the years.If you are unfamiliar with the area, you should use a map to locate the steps onto the bridge from the Rocks. There are 200 steps, but also landings and seats to break up the journey in need.

Great value and spectacular views. . For $13pp this gives great views of the city and the bridge. The small museum is very informative and it is fascinating to learn how the bridge was built. Compared to the money you would spend on a bridge climb, this is gold.

Wow what a view. We didnt have time for the Birdgeclimb so opted for this instead. I am claustrophobic and was unsure how I would go but the staircase to entry level was wide enough that I didnt feel crowded. Stairs actually were more open further up! The views were excellent when up the top and plenty of platforms for a good photo. After decending you can view a movie on the making of the bridge which was excellent as was the information up the top floor. A great not so expensive thing to do in Sydney.

Don't spend a fortune on the Bridge Climb silly, do this, same view and cheap cheap!!!. this is not advertised but in my view the best way to catch the glorious view from the Bridge. You can take your own photos, stay as long as you like, enjoy the little museum and not pay a fortune as you do with the Bridge Climb. Of course the Bridge Climb is an iconic experience and is not scary at all, but the Pylon Lookout is a local secret!!!

Cheaper than a Bridge Climb. If for what ever reason you do not like heights or cant afford to climb the Harbour bridge you can always check the view out from the South bridge pilon. The view isn't as good but still gives you the next best thing
