For more information and photos, please follow this link: http://tummyfull.blogspot.com/2015/05/amazing-sydney-view-from-pylon-lookout.html

A must do!. Visit the Pylon for a small fee and bypass the Bridge walk. When you walk up the winding staircase you will be amazed to find a museum, café and Sydney harbour sights. A truly interesting experience.

Great bargain!. Skip the exorbitantly priced bridge walk and do the 13 AUD pylon climb instead. Includes a small museum and a nice 15 minute photo perspective which is a nice capstone to the museum.Unless you need to burn a lot of calories or money (or just need bragging rights) this is the way to go.

Great view. Having completed the Harbour Bridge walk it was interesting to visit the Pylon. Don't be put off by the steps it is worth it to see the view. Many interesting pictures to see on the way up too.

200 steps ..... but well worth it!!. We were contemplating the bridge walk but poor weather conditions swayed our decision, so instead we opted for the pylon lookout.It's 200 steps to the top but on the way is a landing with some interesting history of the building of the bridge. Being an 'ol git' I got a discount (hooray) which made it even more value for money. The views from the top are stunning and I'm not sure that they'll be bettered by the bridge climb (someone out there will probably correct me though!!).All-in-all great value and a must if you're not going to do the climb. PS - there's no lift by the way.

A bit of hidden gem.. Much cheaper than doing the bridge climb. Not as spectacular but pretty good. The museum inside it is pretty interesting as well. Its only a short walk along the bridge from the rocks..worth doing.

A must see for visitors to Sydney. We have taken family and friends to the Pylon Lookout for many years. There are a lot of steps so won't be good for your granny unless she's really fit but it has a really interesting display about the building of the bridge as well as fantastic 360 degree views of Sydney. To finish there is a great 5 minute film on the building of the bridge. Allow about 30 - 40 minutes to see this attraction. Well worth the price and not overly expensive!

Great views of Sydney. Couldn't justify the price of the bridge climb so made a visit to the Pylon Lookout as an alternative. Wasn't disappointed. Tidbits of information were available on the way up to the lookout point and upon exit there was a small museum which provided fascinating insight into the building of the bridge.
Some of the best views!. We got a free ticket as we did the bidge climb, but would have paid anyway, well worth the 200 stairs climb!! great views a small museam and a gift shop.

Great Views. The Pylons at either end of Sydney Harbour Bridge are part of the iconic outline – and yet….They are not actually an engineering and/or architectural necessity. They don’t do anything for the bridge other than act as sort of bookends to the steel span and thereby give a visual balance. They were a later addition to the design and building of the Bridge.The pylon at the SE corner of the bridge houses the Pylon Lookout. To get there from the Rocks area, there is a staircase from near the junction of Argyle and Cumberland Streets. From the top of this staircase you cross the road and go up a broader staircase to the Bridge walkway. Walk North along this for 400 yards or so to the Pylon: there is no access to the Pylon except on foot.As you ascend the stairs inside the Pylon, there is a lot of interesting material (text, photos, models, film) on the building of the Bridge.From the top (previously used as an anti-aircraft gun platform) you get a great 360 view of the Harbour, Opera House and Bridge.No special equipment required and you don’t have to worry about falling off…

Amazing views of Sydney Harbor and Bridge. This is an excellent alternative to the expensive Bridge Climb. Only $13 and you walk up 200 steps to the top of the South Pylon to view 360 degree views of Sydney Harbor, Opera House, Circular Quay, Western Harbor and the Bridge

Definitely worth while. This is a shorter, less expensive (than the Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb) - though still spectacular way to view the magnificent harbour. There are also informative visual displays showing the construction.

360 Bird eye view of Sydney. This is the best place to be to get the panoramic view of Sydney. The ticket costs 13 Australian dollars, which is cheaper than the bridge climb for those who wanna get the feel on top of the harbour bridge. Inside the tower also has some information on the history about the tower and a souvenir shop. Can get abit crowded if too many people are there, otherwise well worth a visit.

Pylon lookout if you don't have time or the money for bridge climb. We had a limited amount of time in Sydney and did not have the 3+ hours for the bridge climb. Also Climbing the bridge is quite expensive. The pylon gives a great 360 degree view of the harbor and includes a museum. This can all be done in less than an hour. Very good value
Wonderful View. Great view across both the harbour and the City. You have 360 degree views of the bridge and west out to Parramatta river

Terrific Views of Harbour and City. This lookout is a great introduction for any one wanting to get a feel for the Harbour Bridge Climb, without the cost. Climbing a few sets of stairs up inside the Pylon brings you to a secure outside walk around the top of the Pylon itself. The view is 360' as you walk around, looking over the harbour, and it's famous attractions such as the Opera House, and over the city skyline, as well as along the river. Well worth a visit!

Affordable way to capture the sights. Pylon Lookout offers a great way for visitors to take great photos and see the fab views of the harbour and bridge, especially if like me, you prefer to avoid the Bridge Climb.

Bats eye view.. Having done the bridge climb and discovering that you cannot take a camera, for obvious safety reasons, we decided to visit the bridge pylon which houses an exhibition about the building of the bridge and its history. The bridge celebrated its Eightieth birthday a few days after we returned and it was amazing to read the facts about its construction and amazingly how few deaths there were. We could of course take cameras on to the pylon and so although not as high as the bridge itself our lust for high rise photos was sated.

Stunning Views!! . The walk to the pylon is close to the sydney bridge climb shop. Walk up the stairs and out onto the bridge. It has the story of the bridge throughout the climb up the stairs. I dont like heights but this was manageable. I was nervy out at top of the pylon but thats me im sure it wouldnt be a problem for anyone else. I had stunning views of the bridge and the harbour and opera house. I was able to watch my husband and son climb the bridge and it was so nice to share the experience with them. Selfie stick was a great addition.

Great alternative to the SHB itself.... For those who don't have the time or money (or stomach) for the Bridge Climb, the Pontoon is a great choice. 200 steps sounds a lot but it's very easy. The views are fantastic, the museum is interesting including a film, and all for $13 (less if you're a senior!).
views not noticed. I walked by this without thinking it was anything special and only noted that it was considered a tourist attraction

Great place for photos. Instead of the bridge climb, this is a great alternative for a much lower price. You can pretty much get the best pictures of the harbor that you can actually take yourself from here.
our oz trip. If you cannot manage the bridge walk, then this was the next best thing, and not so scary as about 75feet lower
Pylon Lookout. It was good but if you are fit enough, you should walk over the top of the bridge for we regretted not booking once we saw how safe it was.
Easy climb.. Take it slow and you will find it quite easy to get to the top. Much cheaper way to get near the top of the bridge without doing the expensive bridge climb.

It is good but over rated. The journey to the top of bridge is not challenging and its too costly. I don't think the amenities that they provide are really required. But the view form the top is really nice and you can see the whole Sydney. Also, i enjoy the wind at the top of the bridge.
Great Harbour and City Views. Excellent for Harbour, Opera House and City photos if you are unable to climb the bridge. Historical information centre was very informative as well.

Great views guarenteed. If you cant do the Bridge climb this is the next best thing. a self guided tour up the south pylon. $13 admission and a short climb up you have a great 360 view of Sydney. this is a self guided tour. they have several displays showing the construction of the bridge and the history in developing the bridge. The pylon is accessible from the pedestrian walkway on the east side of the bridge.

Pylon Lookout offers spectacular photo opportunities. Pylon Lookout at Sydney Harbour Bridge offers a spectacular opportunity for photographs of the Sydney Opera House, harbour and surrounding city scape. The Pylon Lookout is also home to a historical information centre that tells the story of the Sydney Harbour Bridge in photos, text and video for all to enjoy.

Only 13Aud for a nice view of the bridge. It's Only 13Aud for a nice view of the bridge, when the bridge climbing is about 300Aud.
The small museum in the pylon gives good knowlege about the bridge and the history of it. You may also see a short film (included).
Nice view to the city and to the Opera house.

The Most Beautiful City in the World .... .. is on 360 degree display from the observation deck of the south-eastern pillar of its Harbour Bridge. Access is on Cumberland St - just follow the Bridge Climb signs. The A No. 1 must when visiting Sydney!

Great Views. Got a ticket with our bridge climb good views and lots of interesting reading on the way up, after climbing this we walked over the bridge and got on a ferry another, good way of seeing the bridge ,opera house and city.e

An alternative to the Bridge Climb. If the Bridge Climb isn't for you climb the stairs opposite the Mercantile Pub in George Street and walk onto the pedestrian lane of the Sydney Harbour Bridge. Walk along and enter the pylon which will eventually take you to the top for a view of Sydney Harbour that is just as good as if you were at the top (well, almost). On the way up you can read about the history of the bridge. This is particulary good for people who aren't keen on heights as once you get to the top you are totally surrounded by a high wall. Comfortable shoes are the go and be prepared for stairs, but take your time and it will be worth it!

Nice View and Interesting Museum. After climbing 200 stairs(!) we reached a magical view at over Sydney Harbour and out to the suburbs. On the way up, there are interesting displays about the bridge and its construction. This attraction is quite hard to find for people not familiar with the area around it and could do with some more signs in the local area (The Rocks) leading to the entrance.

very good view. this is about the same hight as the Harbour Bridge but will cost you less $$ but be aware lots of stairs there is a lift but why do the lift if just do the stairs better for You any way plus once you get to the top of the Pylon the best view in Sydney with spending to much $$

Fantastic view, great history. As we did not have time to do the bridge climb, our Sydney-dwelling friends recommended the pylon look-out as an inexpensive and easy way to get the same great views. They were so right. As a bonus, we spent quite a while looking at the displays of the history of the making of the bridge. these were fascinating, not just from the amazing engineering involved, but because of the focus on the personal histories of the people involved.

Great Value with a Great View. My partner and I visited here in a whistle stop few days we had in SYD. I could not fault this attraction for the fantastic value of the entrance fee - around £7.00 GBP each. We were there about 1 1/2 - 2 hours. Very informative and fantastic to get to the top and you not be in a cage above your head!! It was all open air! Very happy!!

The view higher than Bridge Climb. The view is higher than what you can see from the Bridge. It's easy to climb to the outlook. You can see 360 degree of Sydney harbour , enjoy the view as long as you want. There is a little exhibition panels on the wall . History of the bridge for free. There are cheers inside the top of the outlook. There is a photo service for $5. And small exhibition room . You need to pay extra money for entering the room. It's on the middle part of the tower.You can easily see and enjoy Sydney Harbour View. It's budget ! It's not scary to be on the top of the outlook at all. You should go !

great day. Got voucher as I had booked a bridge climb. Easy to find good notices about. Must say beware there's a lot of stairs up to the top and stairs are the open type. Just in case anyone out there has a phobia bout open stairs. There's a lot of info on the way up to stop and look at and get informed drinks and snacks available so far up so take your time and enjoy. Once on top the views are brilliant great views of traffic the opera house and all the quays. And a great view of the bridge especially if your doing bridge climb afterwards. I went to bridge climb shop to make sure of time and to make sure where to go. They verified everything and give me voucher for this pylon lookout. So worth checking in. Then you get voucher straight away

Interesting !. Visited pylon costs about 11 dollars , great views of harbour ... Lots of historic information ..can get crowded we went early to beat the crowds ,as people who have done the bridge climb get free ticket to go in pylons ...
Amazing Views. A very reasonable alternative to climbing the Harbor Bridge, you get a great 360 degree view of the harbor and Sydney plus some photos that show how the bridge was built.

Hike up the Pylon Lookout learn about the bridge and stay for the view. The walk up the pylon is made in sections with benches... really not that hard. The view is great. I learned a lot about how the bridge came about and how it was built. Then continue to walk across the bridge. If you have kids there is an amusement park to visit on the other side take the Ferry back.

Pylon look out - Top View of Sydney Skyline & Opera House. By completing the Harbour Bridge climb we were given entry tickets for the Pylon Look Out. It is quite a distance to walk to the Pylon and once there are a lot of stairs to climb (was told 200 steps, but honestly I lost count!). The walk up to the Pylon Look out is not for the weak knees and not suitable for the disabled. What will you get at the end of the '200' steps up at the Pylon Look Out?? A little bit of history of the bridge and images of the building are displayed at the giftshop area and rest assured of great views at the top of this pylon! I shall say this will be the best place to photograph the Opera House, harbour, and city skyline.
The Pylon. Admittedly we didn't have to pay to climb the Pylon directly as we got it as part of our Bridge Climb ticket but nevertheless the 360 degree views were great.

If you have done the Bridge climb, then you must do this. By completing the Harbour Bridge climb you receive free entry for this attraction.It is quite a distance to walk to the Pylon and once there there are a lot of stairs to climb, but it is worth it once you have reached the top.While climbing the stairs pop into the museum and learn about how this icon was built. At the top you get great views of the groups of climbers making their way up and it brings back nostalgic reminders of when you did the climb yourself. The views are also great, that is why it is another must do, whilst in Sydney.

Brilliant ozzie icon. Having just spent 6 weeks with our daughter and family in Australia ..I looked on trip advisor before we went as I wanted to walk the harbour bridge ..and found comments about the Sydney pylons ..I ask our daughter had she heard of them living there she said NO ..well we went as the bridge walk cost $250 and the pylons cost $12 ..no brainer ...and fantastic ..up as high as the bridge and all the chances for photos ypu want amazing place ..would recommend if you in Sydney give it a go museum s on the bridge history on every landing ..and we did the steps easy ..2 OAPs ...fabulous

What a way to see the harbor - stunning views for only 13aud. Going to the pylon lookout is a "no brainer" only 13 Aussie dollars with memorable panoramic views of the Sydney skyline.Yes their competitors do the bridge climb but they charge 200 aud plus.The lookout isn't just about the views there is alot of memorabilia about the bridge some interesting facts.So give it a go you won't be Disappointed - I wasn't

Worth it for the view but don't get too excited........!. Like others we got a free ticket here after doing the BridgeClimb but I'm not sure I would have bothered otherwise. The view is spectacular when you get to the top but other than that I didn't find it all that interesting. I would've loved to have had a much longer movie with sound to sit and watch, instead of the silent few minute thing that is played. It seemed a bit old and not very engaging but if you want some photos of the great view and you're not doing the BridgeClimb it might be worth the $13 per person for that just for that.

Great spot for Harbour Photos. When I visited the Bridge Pylon Lookout, I thought is was a decent price for access to a great spot to get photos of Sydney's iconic landmarks. Looking at my photos after returning home, I'm very glad I took advantage of this attraction as the elevated view gives a great perspective on the various sights.The corners of the top viewing platform have benches which allow both the photographer and the subject to elevate above the platform walls. This is important if you want to take a picture of someone with the harbour landmarks in the background. Be prepared to be patient as other tourists take their photos then you can do the same.The payment counter is about halfway up the pylon and there is a gift shop at the next level up. Both provide a temporary break from the stairs if you need a rest.

A nice stop on the bridge. If you like to enjoy the many short to long distance walks around Sydney CBD, one of the walks is to jog across the Sydney harbor. One of the pylon (the tall tower structure) of the bridge is open for visitor to walk up and take a full view fo either side of the harbor. if you time your visit right, you can get a beautiful scene here for those who like photography in particular.

Good but can be better. The Pylon Lookout provides great views from the Harbour bridge and one can get excellent views of the harbor, the ships coming in and going out, besides the numerous small boats as well. Great place to click pictures. But the place can be improved as the steel grille that is meant to protect people from either intentionally or unintentionally falling over inhibits clearer views and quality photography. On busy days, this place can be filled with tourists and space is limited.
nice views. It was a long walk to get to but it was worth the walk. Good views of the harbor and opera house. If you have issues walking you do not want to do this.

$13 for a great lookout. We got the Pylon tickets included in the cost of doing the bridge climb. The pylon access is located on the walkway across the bridge, to access the walkway enter from Cumberland Ave. the pylon is the South East one closest to the rocks. There are 200 steps within the pylon plus the steps up to reach the bridge walkway. There are short facts about the bridge build as you go up and benches on the landings. The staircase is also not too narrow so don't worry about it being a frog March as people can overtake you if need be. There is also a water fountain and toilets. The views are amazing and give 360 degrees of the harbour. Take as much time as you want at the top to take pictures. We took pictures of the bridge closer up as we had done the bridge climb, and on the bridge climb you can't take your own camera. (The guide takes pictures for you to purchase).
Must visit if you are able to climb stairs. Interesting walk up the stairs and an opportunity to appreciate how difficult it would have been to build a bridge like this over 75 years ago.

Great views!. Walked along the pedestrian walkway along the Sydney Harbour Bridge. At the pylons in the middle of the bridge there is a viewpoint where you can get great views looking towards the Opera House. we didn't climb up the stairs in the pylons - a good walk and views all for free! From here you can see the Bridge Climbers - locals suggested that unless you are really really keen to do the Bridge climb don't bother, you can get good views for free.

Fab Photo Opportunity. We received a 'free' ticket upon making our booking for the Syndey Harbour Bridge Climb.We didn't have time after our climb, but returned the next day for a photo opportunity. And I'm glad we waited!It's a bit of a climb so take your time, but keep going up because the pictures you can get are just stunning!We arrived just 15min before closing so had to do a bit of a run up and down so missed pretty much all of the museum, but I'd definitely recommend visiting even if it's just for a bridge selfie!

Best view of Sydney. Its a little known secret, but it is worth the climb up the steps inside the pylon on the SE corner. The view is totally stunning and there is an excellent museum about how the bridge was built

Was this where the bridge museum was located?. If so, I found it a bit old and dated and was sorry that the movie about the bridge is longer shown there. To see the movie, you have to go over to the bridge climb place.
Fantastic views. well worth the climb up the steps & only $10 entry fee. Fabulous views from the top & some history to take in too with small exhibits of the construction.

It's a museum!!. The pyloon can be reach easily from the rocks (Circular quay train station will be the closet one, with plenty of bus to Circular quay from different direction).The pyloon lookout basically a museum, showing you the process of build the beautiful Sydney harbour bridge, there are 4 pyloon (which you learn later, that this is only for decorative purpose), but only 1 that you can enter, which is the one close to the city, on Sydney opera house side. The museum is informative, with a lot of interesting fact. From the top, you can look around, including close up of the bridge, which look very fascinating. Also Sydney opera house, the bay around and the building landscape will be on the sight. The entrance fee will be 13 dollar (AUD) for adult, and half price for senior and children, open from 10-5 everyday. If you like history and architecture, you might interested in this place, as i always imagine how they built this immense bridge back to 1930.

Really Interesting. The Bridge Climb took this over and have made it into a museum on the way up to the top of the lookout pylon. Really interesting to see how the bridge was made, some of its workers and actually how far ahead of its time it was when it was built. Great attraction.

Worth the Trip. If you are doing the bridge climb you will get a free admission ticket to the lookout. So pick up your bridge climb ticket as soon as possible so you can get this free ticket from them. We did it the day before our climb and it was well worth it. Nice views

Top View of Sydney Skyline & Opera House. Just a short walk from CBD, Circular Quay or the Rocks. Go to the Harbour Brigge and make your way to Pylon Lookout. Its a short walk 10-20 mins on the bridge. You can have amazing aerial views of Sydney Opera, CBD buildings and the ferries. No need to do the harbour bridge skywalk ($250), if you are a budget traveller. Just get to the Harbour Bridge for free, make your way to the stairs ask for Pylon Lookout and have amazing views. I did half the bridge, took pics, enjoyed the views and then walked back down the Harbour Bridge.

Bridge Climb on a Budget. The bridge climb at Sydney Harbor Bridge costs a bit more than AUD 250 per person. It seemed like a lot for 4 of us to spend. We looked online and several suggested the Pylon lookout as an option. We decided to try it (@AUD 13.50 per person) and if we did not like it, we would reluctantly spend the AUD 1,000 for the 4 of us. We got there a little early on Sunday morning (they only open at 10). The views were fantastic and we were only about 20% or so lower than the top of the bridge. We had a good view of those climbing up the bridge and decided it was not worth it. We could spend all the time we wanted at the pylon lookout, use our own cameras to take all the pictures we wanted and there was also a very informative film showing the construction of the bridge. Overall a wonderful value!

Perfect for us. Ok, so we went into the Sydney Bridge Climb offices and went right back out. I love to zip line and other things but a Bridge climb just wasn't in the schedule given the winds and weather. The Pylon Lookout was a nice replacement for the other. I still had problems with the steps coming down due to cervical spine issue when looking down. At least I didn't freeze up which is what would have happened if I did the bridge climb. I wasn't ready to be rescued and on the news. The Pylon Lookout offers you great views of Sydney so it was very enjoyable. Timing was great as there were not any groups on the Pylon and made it very easy to walk around and take pictures.
Pics and the City. a great place to photograph the harbour, the opera house, the headlands to the ocean and the city skyline. abit breeezy up here but is a nice breeze on a sunny day

Much cheaper than the bridge climb. This is a great way to learn all about the Harbour Bridge. There is a museum all about when it was built and how it was. Plus you can take your own camera up with you instead of paying more for photos like with the bridge climb. It's not as high but it's still an AMAZING view. I think it was about $12 too instead of over $150. Loved visiting the pylon.

The Views!!. I took a friend up here to see the amazing views of the Harbour. I called it the "Poor Man's Bridge Climb". Honestly if you dont have much time in Sydney, and your budget is limited, don't worry about doing a Bridge Climb, just do the Pylon Lookout. Costs $13.The walk up is not too bad. Of course if you have knee issues - then perhaps you should give it a miss. But it is a lot easier to climb than some of the other "climbs" you will do in other major cities around the world.(arc de triomphe, statue of liberty etc).Def do it!!

Great exercise, fantastic views. If you're interested in the Harbour Bridge, you can either pay $$$ to do the bridge climb, or pay $13 to climb 200 steps and still see a fantastic view, enjoy displays and a film about the history of the bridge, and even shop for trinkets inside the pylon. For those who are worried about getting up the stairs, they do provide a few benches at strategic locations up/down the staircase. My only sadness is that I purchased a postcard, paid the fee to get a special cancellation mark from the bridge, but my postcard never made it home to the USA.

Great views. You can be assured of great views at the top of this pylon. Learn the history of the bridge, and see images of the building of it as well as the stories of the builders.Quite a climb via the steps but well worth it for the view at the top.

What a view. Magnificent views of the harbour as well as an informative display. Not many direction signs to follow and we ended up on the road underneath the pylon and had to make our way back up to the entrance which is at the road level.
Stunning evening view/light :-). The view and the light in the evening, before the sun sets, can be spectacular - wonderful place for a few good piccies of the Opera House and the harbour :-)

I climb to the top of the Sydney Bridge at night it was fantastic seeing Sydney at night from the top. There wasn't anything I didn't like the staff put you through a safety drill before you started climbing and you got a photo to take home I would do it again

stunning. the walk up to the pylon top and the view of the Opera House and the Harbor Bridge top is stunning. the timings have to be extended beyond 4.45 pm to experience dusk. the exhibits on the construction were interesting.

Room with a view!. Climbed as my wife was doing the proper Bridge climb. Lots of steps, but the view when you get there is worth it. You have excellent view of Opera House and can see as far as Blue Mountains. Good view of bridge climbers

Good value. We decided we couldn't afford the bridge climb (plus you can't take your camera) so we opted for the pylon. You get good views across the city plus there's a little bit of history about how the bridge was built.

Worth a visit. This is a heck of a lot cheaper than the full bridge walk over the top but is a good way to get the full impact of the harbour from height and there is a nice little museum as you go up which gives the history of the bridge.
Great Views. Great 360 views, there is a small museum on the way up, with some really interesting facts. I will come back one day

Be Fit and Dress up Warm!. A visit to Sydney almost demands you take the long tiring walk up to the top of Sydney Harbour Bridge. Make sure you are fit and be prepared to be windswept and cold particularly in the evening. However all these trials and tribulations are compensated fully when you get to the top and have the most wonderful view down the length Sydney Bay, across to the Opera House and the Botanical Gardens and acroos the bay to manly.

Stunning all-round views of the harbour.. We visited the pylon on our first afternoon in Sydney. The views, as you would expect, are stunning with all the landmarks well signposted on the glass around the top of the wall. There's also quite an interesting, if limited, exhibition about the construction of the Bridge and a small gift shop in the building.
What a view. I did the 200 steps up to the Pylon lookout and oh what a view it was. You could see for miles. The view was awesome, the weather also awesome and it was good exercise also!!

Great alternative to bridge climb. If you are not able to do the sydney bridge climb, this is a great alternative to see some stunning view of the harbour and the city. It requires a bit of stair climbs to reach the spot.

Great History and Views. We enjoyed this visit free with our bridge climb experience, and if it wasn't quite as thrilling it was certainly very enjoyable. The views are not quite as good as from the bridge climb, but being able to bring your own camera is an advantage. I think the two attractions (bridge climb and pylon lookout) complement each other as together you get a good all-round understanding of the Sydney Harbour Bridge.Be prepared for a lot of steps - it was humid on the day we visited and though we are fit we were both sweaty when we reached the lookout.
Lovely views. Reasonably priced and so interesting to read the history of how the bridge was built. Stunning views and not too busy

Pylon view & Walking the Harbour Bridge. Great way to see some of the best views of Sydney Opera House - without the mad crowds!!Try and go early Sunrise or at sunset when the Opera House will be sparkling and WALK THE BRIDGE - it is BRILLIANT!!!Walking across the bridge takes no more than 25mins and you can ferry, train or bus back to Circ. Quays area.

Why Would Anyone Pay $150-$350 pp to Climb the Bridge?. For $15 you can climb the pylon and have the same 360 degree views as from the bridge climb but you can take pictures which you can't do on the bridge climb.I just don't get why so many people pay the extra money to do the climb but I guess they have money to burn or just want to brag that they did it.

Fantastic. Me and a friend looked at climbing the bridge but decided against it due to the cost. We are so glad we didn't as the views from the top of the pylon are excellent and nearly as high. You can see full 360 degrees unrestricted allowing for great photos. The added bonus was the museum explaining the history of the bridge which was fascinating. We spent 2hrs in total and loved the whole experience.

Good views. You will have to climb 200 steps but the views are nice over the Opera house, harbour and bridge. There are a few exhibits but they could do with more. The short audiovisual display gives a good summary of the bridge's construction. Free entry if you have done the Bridge Climb.

Brilliant Views. I thought this attraction was very good value, loads of interesting information to read on the way up, and then however long you want to photograph probably the best views in Sydney. Highly recommended!

Climbing the Bridge. This is a tourist attraction not to be missed. If you are lucky to get good weather which I did you can see far away all over Sydney.Some people are fearful because of the height, but one doesn't feel it is high at all and it is entirely safe. It can be climbed at night too so people attending this attraction can see Sydney inall its beauty night or day.

A cheap interesting view from Sydney Harbour Bridge. Not a lot of tourists know that you can pay a modest amount and go up the stairs inside the Pylon nearest the Rocks to see a magnificent Harbour view. Inside you will find Historic photos of how the Bridge and Tunnel were constructed which are fascinating to the ladies and men are in their element. Kids enjoy it too and should learn about how the World's Icons came into being. I take students there as it is much cheaper than other attractions. The stairs are very steep.

A great alternative to Bridge Climb. For less then $15 you can go up the pylon lookout for brilliant views of Sydney Harbour. It's not much lower than the too of the bridge itself and there are great views on a clear day. There is a small museum on the way up with info about the bridge and it's history. You wouldn't see much more doing the $200 bridge climb so unless you really want to say you have climbed the bridge this is a great value alternative.
So.... I think the view from the bridge itself was almost as good as from the pylon, and since you have to pay to go up there, i'd rather enjoy the view from the bridge.

Pylon Lookout is a bargain compared to the Bridge Climb!. As much as I've always wanted to the Bridge Climb, with it's exhilarating views and all, I find the expensive price to be a turn-off. So I decided to check out the Pylon Lookout instead, for just $13.50! As you walk up a series of stairs to the top, there is a museum of sorts with plenty of photos and memorabilia showing many aspects of the construction of the amazing Harbour Bridge. It's a wonderful casual journey to the top (unless you're not fond of stairs), however once outside on the top of the Pylon Lookout, you get some incredible views of not only the bridge, but also of the Sydney Opera House, the harbour, and the downtown. You can even see all those that spend the few hundred dollars for the Bridge Climb off to your left, making their way up to the top of the arch of the bridge. They may be just a tad higher than us at the Pylon Lookout, but the views we both receive are out of this world! And the best part, we paid far less.

Great view. We didn't quite get all the way to the top of the Pylon Lookout because it was closed, but I can't see how the view could have been that much better than standing at the entrance.The entrance had a great view of the Harbor to the Opera House, and allowed for great pictures for those of us who are too chicken to go on the bridge climb! This allowed for perfect pictures from this side of the Harbor and a great perspective too.

Easy, quick way to see the harbour bridge, cheaper than the climb. There are 2 pylons on the bridge, one at each end. The pylon lookout is located on the south side, closer to the rocks. It is easy to get to, just 10 minutes walk from the rocks, and costs $13 to get in. You go to the top of the tower and get a great view of Sydney and the bridge itself. You can see the groups of bridge climbers climbing the bridge itself. I didn't get enough time to do the bridge climb, so this was an opportunity to get as close to the bridge structures as possible and get a good look. It's certainly worth it for those who are unable to or choose not to do the bridge climb.

Great panoramic view of Sydney Harbour. Catch the train to Milson's Point Station then walk across the Harbour Bridge. A great view of Sydney Harbour can be seen from the Southern Pylon ($13 adult, $8.50 students and $6.50 children). Then walk down to Circular Quay. This is an inexpensive way to see Sydney from a less touristy perspective. Our overseas guests really enjoyed it!

Gives you the photo you want over the harbour. This is a relatively cheap thing to do, but worth it. It's a bit of a climb but once at the top you get an amazing view of the bridge and the harbour giving you that photo and selfie you want of Sydney.

After you climb the bridge this is just ok. A lot of steps and a great view but you lose the sense of achievement you get from the bridge climb. You are given a free ticket with your climb, but just skip it and do something else!

Worth every pennie. The pylon lookout is one of the highlight that you can get in Sydney, it cost only 13$ per adult and it is very nice walk from the Rock to the pylon ... However, to get to this place you need to be in good fit, there are about 200 stairs in the pylon and about 100 more before you get there, it is not accessible for Disabled so take it into consideration, and the vies is breathtaking...

the cheaper bridge climb. This little climb up to the topof the pylons is worth the effort and from the pictures and exhibits you get a little historical info on the bridge construction.The fee is considerably less than the big climb and if your short on time as we were , it's a good substitute.

Feat of engineering. This attraction on the Sydney Harbour Bridge was a very good hour spent looking into the history of this feat of engineering. It didn't cost much and the only thing I feel they could add would be a soundtrack to the film shown just prior to leaving. They had some excellent set of blaack and white photos on the film that would have been enhanced by a good narrative.

Great view of the Sydney Skyline. This is definitely a must visit attraction for any visitor visiting Sydney. Its best to get to the harbour via train and get off at Milson's Point train station. You could climb up the bridge and use the side walk to take some shots of the city skyline. To get hold of a good shot of the bridge, head towards Jeffrey Street Wharf (Kirribilli area). You could also fit the harbour and the Opera House, both in one frame!

very good views. this is a cheaper and maybe better option than the bridge climb if you don't think you can do that. yes there are a lot of stairs to climb, but there are exhibitions on every other landing, you can get your photo done as well. 13 dollars is an inexpensive way of getting the views, i was gonna do the bridge climb but your not allowed to take cameras and therefore it will be done by the guide,so i took the Pylon Lookout option instead. they are very good views and you can click away to your hearts content. there is lots of information on the planning and building of the SHB and even a little gift shop. you can get a great shot of the Opera house as well. every 6 mins there is a short film about the bridge construction in a little theatre. after finishing, i walked across the bridge and back again. all in all a very nice experience

Great view for a fraction of the cost. The Pylon Lookout is a wonderful thrify alternative to the Sydney Bridge Climb. I'm sure it's a much different experience, but the view is wonderful and we did a lot of other things in Sydney for the $570 difference in price between the two attractions. Their website had a good map of how to find the stairs and there are exhibits on the way up to stop and look at on the construction and history of the bridge.

What a View. We went to Pylon Lookout on a sunny afternoon and what a view!. As you go up, you can read the history about the bridge and see the models and old photos. Once you get outside,you see South Sydney, Opera House and of course the bridge with all the traffic below you. Worth visiting.
A place to view Sydney Harbour. A few stairs but well worth the walk. A good view and some interesting facts on the way.Take the walk across the Harbour Bridge afterwards

Great Value. We did the Bridge Climb and Pylon Lookout and have to say the views are similiar but the price poles apart. Bridge Climb being $250 as opposed to Pylon Lookout $13. The museum at the Pylon Lookout is also fantastic with lots of information, stories and displays. You can also take your own camera which isn't allowed on the Bridge Climb. Bonus.Highly recommend!

Stunning views. This is a lovely way if you don't want to do the climb over the bridge. Take a stroll across the bridge at your own leisure and use the lookout to see over the harbour. The only shame is for photos the safety wire is in the way of your pictures .

The "original" Bridge Climb. The Pylon lookout has been a cheap and cheerful way to look out over Sydney Harbour for years. Lots of information about how the Bridge was built and a great view over Sydney Harbour.
Easily accessible if you walk across the Bridge from Milson's Point or from the Rocks.
Lots of stairs!

Fantastic views!. Received a complimentary ticket with our bridge climb. A decently easy walk up to the top with magnificent views as your reward. You can actually look down onto the bridge span and see people walking on the bridge. Also has a little bit of the history of the bridge as well as a gift shop.If you don't have the time or the $ to do the bridge climb this is a great alternative.

A pylon with a view. I guess if you are either walking across the bridge or over the bridge (Sydney Bridge Climb) then you will definitely be seeing the pylon.But you can actually climb up inside the South East Pylon for more views without the hefty price tag of the Bridge Climb.Is it a must do? Probably not but if you are visiting then yes you might as well while you are here.

A cheaper option to the bridge walk. Couldnt justify the cost for the bridge walk so did the pylon lookout which was really informative about the bridge construction and the view off the top are brilliant

For the Experience. Good for those who are afraid of height (I do), short of time or on budget. For the bridge climb you need 4 hours. At least $ 200.00 upwards per person to do that. Pylon Lookout only cost $ 13.00. You see what they see but minus the thrill & experience of the climb. But you still need to climb more than100 flights of stairs (i lost count) to go up there. 360D of view from up there.

wow great view and great value!. We picked this one instead of the harbour bridge climb because this one only cost for us $13, the bridge climb it was almost $300. So if you are looking to save money you really should pick this one because you will get the same view and also you can bring your camera, the other one didn't allow for us to bring our cameras! Perfect choice

Great Visit. Having completed a great bridge climb we had free access to the pylon - We would have very happily for this excellent visit.Steps up took us past bridge building history to another set of really interesting explanations about the build. Views across the harbour and up to the bridge spans are excellent and well worth the effort of walking to the pylon and taking the steps up. Excellent, free or paid for!

Wow, forgot how amazing this is! Amazing, cheap Sydney attraction... Honestly took a visiting friend (who had done Bridge Climb before) and we both really enjoyed it. I think it was about $13.00 its great value and also alternative I think to doing the Bridge Climb. Save a couple hundred, and splurge elsewhere!! Also forgot you can bring your own camera equipment, I saw some with selfie sticks (can't take photographs on Bridge Climb)!
Great views.. One good thing is it is cheap to see the best views of Sydney. Getting such a close up look at the bridge is good and the Sydney air was so clean up there. What a city.

Panoramic view of Sydney. I enjoyed the view at Pylon Lookout. It costs somewhere between $10-15 to get up there, but the view is nice. There are some information up at the top about the history of the Sydney Harbour Bridge.Sure, you could get a nice view walking on the Sydney Harbour Bridge, but I preferred Pylon Lookout because there weren't wire fences obscuring my view. Also, you truly get a panoramic view of Sydney, which I thought was cool. Plus, you could observe people doing the bridge climb, which I thought was rather amusing.

Great view.... Its not a free viewing point it’s at a charge $13 per adult and open only until 5pm. Gives you great opportunity for photography....Fantastic views of the city, Harbour Bridge can be captured from here. Wear your most comfortable foot ware and carry a small water bottle :)
Run of the mill. We did not go up. We walked across the bridge and had great views. We figured another 30 meters in height is not going to extend the views enough to warrant paying. IMO

Panoramic Views of Sydney!. Excellent views of the city on a gorgeous day! After climbing the bridge we went to the Pylon which was included in our ticket, we took amazing panoramic shots of the city all round. Excellent experience!
worthwhile!. I actually liked it more than the bridge itself..:) I loved the view and the scenic Sydney. It is almost free as well!

Really enjoyed this lookout. After meandering through the Rocks we made our way to the Sydney Harbour Bridge pylon lookout. We really enjoyed the easy walk up to find fabulous views with lots of interesting facts to learn along the way. This is a recommend!
Good - not great. It was good to see all Sydney from up, but I am not sure that it was worth the money to get in. Lucliky, we got free ticket after we have climbed Sydney Bridge.
great views. well worth the 415 warning quite a few steps but when you get to the top you have a panoramic view across Sydney harbour breath taking and perfect for pictures
Better value than BridgeClimb. Great view, interesting history on the construction of the bridge. Better value than BridgeClimb - recommended.
Worth It. We paid for the Pylon Climb and felt it very worthwhile. The observation deck includes inscriptions on the glass retaining wall describing what you see from various vantage points.

Well worth it. Brilliant view and only cost 13 dollars each well worth a visit and a fraction of the cost of the Sydney bridge walk and you can stay up there as long as you want and take as many photos as you like . Not well advertised though

Great views. This was included in our Harbour Bridge climb ticket and well worth the walk up the stairs to the top. Stunning views of Circular Quay and the Opera House. We also saw a storm roll in giving great pictures.

Great views. We had a free admission to this attraction that was part of the price of the Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb. Otherwise the price is A$13 which we thought was a fair price. There is only stair access as far as we could see. Great pictures, displays and information about the building of the bridge and an 8 minute film as well. Entering the outside you can walk right around the top of the pylon for 360 degree views. There are close views of the bridge also. It is worth climbing all the stairs!
Great spot!. Nice harbour view and city. Nice for photos. Be prepared for a lot os steps. After all the steps go for a pub next to the Pylon Lookout for a rest.
Best view of the harbour . We were going to do the bridge climb and decided the cost wasn't worth it. Then my wife found this. Brilliant. Informative, cheap & easy. Well worth it.

Great views. Lots of stairs to climb to the top- no elevator. Great displays all the way on how they built the bridge and artifacts collected. Good variety of souvenirs for sale. The view is spectacular in all directions - 360 degrees. You need to stand on benches to see over the top and take your photographs. Very safe even though there were lots of other tourists

360 degree views. The first few flights of stairs are fairly narrow but from then on open out to wide easy steps. Read about the construction and history of the bridge. Once up the top the views are awesome in every direction. Look closely on the perspex panels for orientation of Sydney's landmarks. Souvenior shop, drinking fountain, seating and bathroom facilities available. Worth the entrance fee.
Well worth the climb. Having climbed the 200 stairs to the top you are rewarded with panoramic views of Sydney. The Opera house is very close.
great way to get a good photo. You'll get some good photos here! We had a nice time at this overlook as it had amazing views. Take a look!
Fantastic View !. Short walking distance from the Rocks / Circular Quay. Fantastic view of the Opera House & Sydney Harbour Bridge day and night ! Good walking & relaxing !

Great attraction as alternative to bridge climb.. This hidden gem gives great harbour views and wonderful history of the bridge. Great for those not keen on the bridge climb. And good value for money too. Thoroughly enjoyed it.
Amazing Views!. Very amazing views and much cheaper than the actual sydney bridge climb! Do not miss out on this attraction!

Much better option then Harbour Bridge Climb. I decided to do this pylon climb/lookout after baulking at the staggering prices to do the bridge climb (about $250) this climb is only $13 per adult which is a huge saving over the former. The view from comparing it to photos is just as good and the other benefit is that you are allowed to take your own camera. You can't take your camera on the bridge climb. If you are an avid photographer like me then the choice is simple.

Great. My son went for the harbor climb while me and my wife climbed the pylon!! Great view from all sides with added advantage of keeping close watch on the happenings on the bridge - me a parent. Great show at the exit too.

Great place to get some pics. The high vantage point over the harbour and city make this a great place to take pics, if you do the bridge climb as well you get free entry to the pylon and the exhibition recaps and adds to much covered by climb leader
Value for money. Not as expensive as the bridge walk but you can use yoiur own camera and get some great views of the harbour and Opera House.
Spectacular views of Sydney!. Entry was free with the Sydney Bridge tour. The views from the Lookout are outstanding... can see the harbor and the city line!

A great Lookout and an easy climb to view the harbour. Excellent experience, and not too costly either. An easy option for those who feel they can't do a full bridge climb. Great views of the harbour.

Hefty price but what a view.... The pylon lookout gives you an amazing view of the city skyline and the harbour. One of the best places to get an amazing panorama shot. No other place can give you such a view of Sydney and the harbour. Sure to be on the list.

Interesting!. Stumbled across this as I was walking across harbour bridge and it was 13 dollars well spent in my opinion. Lovely views of the opera house and the city. Great photos can be taken from the top and the history of the bridge construction is portrayed in a small museum on the way up which is interesting. If you have a spare 30 minutes on your way over the bridge then go for it!

Sensational Photo Opportunity. The Pylon Climb is a wonderful and iconic attraction, often recommended as an alternative to those not wishing to participate in the BridgeClimb.The views are spectacular, it's cost effective, you have the opportunity to take your own photographs, and more importantly to those travelling with younger children or elderly, it's less taxing physically. Combining this activity, with perhaps a walk across the pedestrian path of the bridge, then a ferry back from Kirribilli, is a wonderful way to spend an afternoon.It would be one of my top three recommendations, for all leisure visitors to Sydney.
Budget Bridge Climb. Cheap, quick, no need to book, but great views of the Harbour. Great photos from here too. Not many stairs and some interesting information on show.

Great views. Completed the Bridge Climb and then wandered over to the Pylon for a tour of the bridge construction museum. Another bell ringer and worth the experience. Fee is acceptable at $13 or if you climb the bridge, it comes as part of the package. Great experience and even better views.
The Best View. Cons: 200 stairs and no lift.Pros: the view, the view. It is a view of the bridge and harbour and city you will only get from climbing the bridge without the expense. Specular.

Forget the expensive bridge climb, do this instead much cheaper!. So I considered the bridge climb for all of about 10 seconds after seeing the price (about $250) then fortunately I stumbled across this place on trip advisor. It only costs $13 a fraction of the cost of the other!!! And with this one you climb to the top of they pylon, the view is just as great. The other bonus apart from saving a huge amount of money is that you can take your own camera! And take as many awesome photos as you want! The bridge climb doesn't allow you to take your own camera and you have to pay yet more money to buy one of their photos! Take the tip and do this climb instead. You can thank me later!
Great views. You can take your camera up (unlike the bridge climb) so you can take as many photos of the great views as you like.
For a view of the bay. Probably the best place to take your own pictures of the bay, the harbor, the city. A good climb however. The history of the construction of the bridge is interesting
Pylon Lookout. No cameras are allowed on the Bridge Walk, so going up the Pylons, which is included in the Bridge Walk ticket was an opportunity to take photographs from a good vantage point.

so worth the climb. remembered this from the days of visiting sydney as a child, when there was no bridge climb. took some friends there for a great look out and vantage of sydney. quite a climb up the stairs but fully worth it, and a great walk over the bridge to get there

Do this instead of the Bridge Climb and save $$$$. Truth is that I couldn't afford over $200 to do the bridge climb, so I greatfully stumbled across this on trip advisor and I am glad I did! Only $13 per adult for entry and to be honest from what I gathered the view is almost as good as the bridge climb but with the added benefit of not as crowded, plus you don't have to wear those funny looking grey suits plus you can take your OWN camera and take as many photos as you want without having to buy their 'official photos' at a greatly inflated price! I can't recommend this activity enough if you are in Sydney visiting.

Spend the Time. Take the time to appreciate the history contained in the pylon. It is very interesting experience and the history of the construction is also interesting. Allow and hour to get the best experience.

Well worth a visit!. Having walked across the bridge and already having had good views of the opera house, we thought twice about going up the pylon, but we were so glad we did. I think the $13 entrance fee is reasonable (and nothing compared to the cost of the bridge climb!). There's lots of interesting information about the bridge construction and 360 degree views of the harbour when you get to the top, perfect photo opportunities. Recommended!

Pylons - views. How great it is to go up the lookout and see what marvoulous views of Sydney Harbour also you can see the bridge walkers. But the views are breathtaking on a beautiful day and inside the information about the bridge is so so interesting. a must do.

Pylon Lookout at Sydney harbour views. reasonable price of entry , some really interesting history of how the bridge was built , worth the entry fee alone . Good 360 degree views in the open air , you can look down on the bridge" climbers " who have paid a fortune to actually " walk " across the top of the bridge .

Good views. I'm not sure this is really worth the $13 per person to view the harbour, city, and surrounding area. The scenes from the bridge level are almost as good. But if you want a higher view this is a great option. It's definitely better than paying over $200 to do the bridge climb, particularly when a camera is not allowed on the climb. For the budget minded, the bridge level views are almost as good.

Stunning views. When researching the BridgeClimb experience, I was disappointed to learn that we couldn't take our own cameras. Combined with the price, it was a deal-breaker for me. Someone recommended the Pylon Lookout as an alternative, and it did not disappoint. I spent nearly an hour camped atop the pylon taking photos and simply soaking in the sun and the view. Amazing. Well worth the price and the climb.

Sydney's top view.. If you don't have the time or cash to spend on climbing the bridge, you can go up the pylon for $12 and view the facinating museum photos and film and look out over the city, harbour and Opera House for as long as you like. Magnificent!!!!!!!!
Great view. 200 steps up, you have a wonderful view of the harbour area and especially Sydney Opera House. Recommended for all those with not enough nerves to climb the "coat hanger" itself ;-)

Best for Sydney Harbour Photos. We climbed the bridge, great sensation and to die for views, but the only photos are the ones the guide takes (of you with Sydney background! So climbed up inside the pylon (a small fee unless you do the Bridge Climb aswell, first)) and great photo opportunities.It is quite a few steps (about 4 stories?) but you can go your own pace. If you cant climb the Bridge (takes time, some fitness and money) an excellent alternative.
Great for school excursions. Sweeping views of the harbour, scenic surroundings, nice little museum too. Admission price not too steep, friendly front-house-staff.

Better than I thought it would be. I met my photography group at Milsons Point and then we walked across the bridge to arrive at the Pylon Lookout, on the city side of the bridge. I hadn't been there before but, for a small entrance fee, you can see a museum recalling the development and building of the bridge. There are quite a few steps to climb to get to the lookout but when you get there ... wow! You can walk around the pylon to shoot photos (or just take in the view) of the bridge, the city and the harbour. I was really pleasantly surprised and would recommend a visit.

Must go again... I first visited this in 1961. My grandfather made the first telescope to be placed there, so this review is a bit nostalgic. I remember the views were fabulous long before the 'Bridge Climb' was available. I must visit again to see if the old telescope is still up there.
Great for Pictures. You can't take cameras along on the Bridge Climb so this is the next best place to get those photos.Posted directions could be better to the pylon.
Great views. We got the ticket free as part of the bridge walk. The views are superb of the harbour and close ups of the bridge. Well recommend this if you have the time.

Worth the climb. Unlike the bridge climb you can take your camera. There are a lot of stairs to climb but there are places to rest and it's worth the effort of getting up there. Great views of Sydney, the harbour and beyond and you can stay up there as long as you want. There is a small gift shop and toilets. I recommend it is put on the 'to do' list and I would do it again if I am in Sydney.

Nice views and 200 steps. We found this to be a place with some nice views of the harbor. The steps might be an issue but there are landings about every 15 steps where you can take a break if needed. Don't really get any good views until the top and it is a fairly small area but the views of the Opera House and Harbor are very good. If you are not going to do the Bridge Climb, this can be a good alternative. There is some historical info and a movie about the bridge.

A must do when in Sydney. I did this climb after reading all of the fantastic reviews on Tripadvisor. I couldn't justify paying almost $300 for the harbour bridge climb, the cost is prohibitive and not only that but they don't let you take your own camera and charge you to buy their photos that they take of you on the climb. No thanks!! So I did this instead, it only costs $13 per adult!!! And the views are just as good as the bridge climb although not quite as high up the view is the same really and you can take as many photos as you want for free with your own camera!! Absolute bargain and a must do when in Sydney in my opinion

A unique perspective of the bridge and harbour. If you like taking photos get yourself up here. There's an entry fee - a bit steep,haha, I thought, but worth the aspect. Plus it's just so nice to walk across this iconic piece of architecture and really feel Sydney. You don't have to do the pylon but do the walk in any case.

Great views. Great alternative to the Bridge Climb if you don't like heights. Also if you are a UK senior citizen entry will be $8 instead of $13. Plenty of interesting information to read on the way up so don't worry about the stairs, they are quite easy.

If you don't want to do the climb...... This is a great way to see the harbour if you don't want to do the bridge climb. We did both with the pylon being the first day. Views to the opera house and harbour are excellent.

Stunning views of Sydney. By far one of the best spots to take your loved one for some great views and photos of Sydney. The displays and historical aspects of the bridge made the climb up the stairs much easier. Great attraction all round.

Stunning Views. Brillant place, such History and adventure, so much to do and see
looking over our Stunning Harbour and our Bridge oh what a sight

Best views. well worth the stairs and only $13 it is a bargain for the views. Stunning 360 degree views of Opera House and Bridge. You can see the bridge climbers easily but they can't take their camera, I prefer to take my own pictures, may be great for a sunset
Great. See previous review for Bridge itself for comments tips, about this attraction, it is well worth the effort

Skip the Bridge Climb. Don't bother with the Bridge Climb, it isn't value for money.
The Pylon provides the same panoramic 360 degree views of the Opera House, the Harbour and the skyline at a fraction of the price.

A must do in Sydney. A fascinating museum AND stunning views from the roof.
You MUST do this while you're in Sydney. You will not be disappointed, especially if you are interested in learning about the harbour bridge being built.

A must do when in Sydney. this is by far the cheapest option to get on the Bridge and enjoy the view.
The historical aspect alone is fantastic but the view is unbeatable indeed.
Walk from Macquarie st across the Cahill Expressway to the pylon to maximise the enjoyment and feel of the harbour.
Just do it :)
History of the Bridge. Interesting historical talk about the building of the Bridge. However, it's best done when the wind is low. Good views over the harbour. Not expensive.

Worth a visit. If you do the bridge walk you'll get free entry to this attraction. It hasn't got much more than the Bridge Attraction itself but the views from the top of the Pylon make it worth the visit. You can get some excellent photo opportunities from here which you aren't allowed to on the bridge walk and although not as high, is still none the less impressive.

Beautiful views. Really enjoyed this, having done a bridge walk in New Zealand, it was nice to get the same kind of experience in Sydney without the high cost. I believe that the cost may have been worth it for someone eager to do a walk, but the Pylon was perfect for us. The views were fabulous and could take your own time and pictures. Along the protective glass, are coordinates and place name so you could figure out what you were looking at in the distance... and well known attractions like the opera house were clear to see. This would also be better for anyone with a fear of heights too, but would like to overlook the city!
Fantastic. Worth the walk , not scary like the harbour climb however different experience ....great views and no glass so a huge bonus ...
Great views. Much cheaper than the bridge climb (although I am sure it is worth the extra $$$), the pylons provide great views of the harbour.

Sydney Harbour Bridge Pylon. If you are looking for a lower cost alternative to the bridge climb, I recommend going to the roof of the pylon. It is atop an interesting museum and you do not have to book in advance. The view is almost as good. Especially good for the height-phobic.
Fantastic views. A great experience, the views are wonderful and you really have the feeling of being high up and seeing all around
Beautiful view of the Harbour and City. Amazing views on gorgeous days.. the middle level takes you through the history of the bridge.. The view are spectucular and speaks for itself.

Iconic views. Far cheaper and a lot less strenuous than the bridge climb. 100 or so steps takes tou up the pylon to a viewing area at the top where, unlike on the bridge climb, you can take photos. A well presented small museum gives an interesting history of the bridge and its construction.

Great alternative to the climb. Wonderful views and experience. Highly recommend it. You are up and up high. The climb is easy. Nice wide stairs and places to rest but I didn't need them. Easy walk up. I am not wild about heights but had no problem. Ther's a wall and plexiglass. Very good value At just 12$ a person
Lovely bridge view. Yes quite a few steps but excellent view. If a friend is climbing the bridge then you have an ideal location for photos

Less expensive way to see bridge and harbour. Rather than spend AUS 250 each to climb the bridge, we choose this at AUS 13 each. Got really good views of Opera House and harbour as well as being able to get the history behind the bridge. We were happy with our decision.

Great . If you find the prices to climb the bridge too pricey this is a perfect alternative.
The views are amazing the price was reasonable and my family enjoyed it a lot.

Challenging but you'll get a different view of bridge. I recently went up the pylons after I got a free pass for doing bridge climb. It had been 15 years since I had walked up and back then it was free. My profile pic is of the bridge from the pylon. It's well worth going up for the view and if you are a photographer. You get a different perception of the bridge. HOWEVER it is a lot of stairs to get to the top. Not for the elderly, really unfit or people with injuries. I'm pretty sure there isn't a lift.
PANORAMIC VIEW. We stopped at the Pylon before our ascent at the Bridge: then we climbed the bridge itself. The sense of freedom is impossible to forget.

Do this instead of the Harbour Bridge climb and save money!!. Okay so again trip advisor steered me onto this place after reading all the reviews. I couldn't justify spending close to $300 (crazy prices) on climbing the harbour bridge, when this was only $13!!! What a bargain seriously the views are almost as good as what the people on the harbour bridge climb would have had, however at a fraction of the cost. Basically you climb up inside one of the pylons on the opera house side of the harbour and there is a lookout on top of the pylon. Another added bonus.........you can take your camera and take as many photos of the magnificent view as you like! With the harbour bridge climb they don't let you take your camera up there and they charge you a small fortune to buy the photos that they take of you!I honestly highly recommend this activity. If you have the money and can justify it then by all means climb the bridge, but this is just as good so much cheaper! A must do when you visit Sydney!
Great views of Sydney. Great views over Sydney, again well priced. Lots of stairs but worth doing. There's a nice little gift shop up there and certainly sells stuff that I didn't see anywhere else.
Great views AND price!. No need to do the bridge walk to get incredible views of the city at a fraction of the cost. We also really enjoyed the movie at the end about the history of the bridge.

A definite must when visiting Sydney. I was really keen to do the Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb but after reading many reviews on Trip Advisor I opted to do the Pylon Lookout instead. It was nowhere as costly and we could take many amazing photos from this spot. There is lots to read and learn about in relation to the history of the Bridge and some wonderful old photos to view that show how the bridge was built. You are unable to take photos when doing the Bridge Climb so this also made this option more appealing to me. The Bridge Climb takes a lot longer to do especially given the safety part that must be undertaken. This freed up our day to do more. We then continued walking over the whole bridge on the walkway taking in the stunning view and had fish and chips under the Bridge at the other end. This was a superb day and one I will never forget. A much better and affordable option for a family.

Magnificient views. While the kids were doing the BridgeClimb, we used the supplied complimentary passes to view the pylon.The view of the bridge and the climbers is great as are the views across the harbour.The history of the bridges construction is also enlightening.The movie could use some commentary.

60% of the bridge climb. A cheaper version and almost as exhilarating as a bridge climb, the Pylon lookout is about 60% the height of the top of the harbour bridge. A relatively inexpensive entry fee, then a climb up the stairs at your leisure while viewing historic photos of the construction of the bridge and the roadway. from the top you can take as many photos as you like with your own camera, free of charge - and as mentioned the view is as spectacular as from the top of the bridge.

Great views. At $13 a head for adults, its a bit overpriced for what you get...$5 each would have been more appropriate. Despite that, the walk up through the display areas is very informative and gives a great insight into the building of the bridge and the incredible task that it was. Once at the lookout at the top of the pylon, the view is amazing and even more so for me as I was able to watch (and talk to) family members who were doing the Bridge Climb, start their ascent up the arch (I have a loud voice). Definitely worth the visit.

We worth your dollars spent...... Well worth your $11.00 especially it is your first time walking the bridge. Small cinema showing some history about the bridge etc., beautiful top area to take stunning photos.

Nearly as good as climbing the bridge!. This is at the Sydney end of the Bridge and gives excellent views. If you're not going to climb the bridge, then climb this as the views are nearly as good as from the top of the bridge. Excellent info on the way up too.
Bit pricy. Rather expensive to walk up a few flights of stairs. Its a bice enough view... but would get more people coming up and probably make more money with a reasonable price... like a gold coin.
Great view!. Loved this lookout - definately worth going to if you can't afford the bridge climb. Great view for photos and learning about the construction of the bridge.

Very nice. I wasn't going to do this, but I got a free pass when I did the Bridge Climb and thought why not? And I have to say it was worth it, you get some amazing views and on a clear day can see right across the city.

Excellent view. Head up to the Pylons from Cumberland street near The Rocks Market. A nice short stroll along the bridge will lead you the the entrance of the Pylon lookout. There was a small entry fee to pay but it was totally worth the visit. Following the flight of stairs up, you will see the history of the sydney bridge construction and small little monuments. At the top of the tower, the view was breath-taking with a clear view of the Sydney Opera House. You can observe the sydney bridge climbers from the lookout too. After you've spent as much time as you want on the top level, you can make you way down to a small museum and a short film on the construction of the bridge and how the Pylon was a mere decorative monument. I highly recommend to those too afraid to climb the bridge or not willing to pay 300bucks for an aerial view.

Great view. In itself, the Pylon Lookout is overpriced since it's something around 13 AUD at least. But we got the tickets for "free", since we did the Harbour Bridge Climb.This is one of the best places to get great photos of the Opera House and city skyline. Recommended.
Wow!!. If for whatever reason you cannot do the bridge climb, this is the next best thing. Breathtaking views and interesting displays even for a hardened Sydneysider!!

Be there at 4.30pm!. It closes at 5.00pm every day.The best is to climb up just before closing to catch sunset. Especially in Winter you must catch a stunning view! This is the place you must visit when you walk around Rocks.

A great view! . I had the chance to visit the Pylon Lookout at Sydney Harbor Bridge today with my friends from Embassy English. We went there on an excursion and had a great time. We were accompanied by a guide who provided us with information about the history of the Sydney Harbor Bridge. Once we were at the top of the Pylon, the view was breathtaking.

Good view for a cheap price!. It´s cheap (around ($13) and the views are fantastic. You do have to climb the 200 steps to the top, but for those who are fit it´s no problem. There is a good display of pictures and items related to the building of the bridge and because they are interesting and entertaining, you don´t feel the climb. If you have enough time during your visit to Sydney, if you are fit and don´t want to spend $$$ to climb the bridge, then this is for you. And if you are an engineer or a builder, then this is a must!

Fantastic View. Just a breathtaking view of the Harbor & Opera House. It was very interesting because they explained how the Harbor Bridge was built and many interesting facts. Have been to Sydney many times and this was my first time. I would recommend it.

Look Straight Up The Walkway. a great place to get photos of the Bridge, Circular Quay, Opera House and the Harbour. At the top you can look straight up the walkway of the bridgeclimb and see climbers close up. There are quite a few stairs to get to the top so not ideal visiting later in the day after a busy day sightseeing. There is a shop inside the pylon to pick up souvenirs along with displays of the history in Sydney. There is a small fee for this but if you do the bridgeclimb you get a free admission ticket from there for the Pylon. A great place to visit at least once

not worth the entry fee. I only went on the pylon because I had a free ticket with my harbour bridge climb. It was beautiful and I got some great photos but you can't see sunset on it because it closes at 5pm.when I went, the entry was $13 for an adult, and unless you have a free ticket, I wouldn't recommend going.

Absolutely must do!. This was one of the highlights of our 5 days in Sydney - the views are amazing! You can really see the whole city up here and feel the vibes from the harbour! We looked into doing the bridge climb, but decided to skip it and just do the pylon lookout instead and I'm glad we did. The weather was a touch rainy during our time in Sydney so we were able to do the Pylon Lookout at our convenience when the weather cleared. Great photo ops and fun to read about the history of the bridge. An absolute must do in my opinion!!

Sometimes less is more. Excellent value for money, at a fraction of the price of the bridge walk. Great little museum on the construction and history of the bridge and mesmerising views from the outside walkway at the top. The stairs up were nothing like as many as we were expecting, so if you have any doubts about whether you're physically up to the challenge of the bridge walk, this could be a great alternative. Bring your comera of course, and a windproof jacket if you're here in Winter. Allow a good couple of hours to get the most from the museum and the views.

A Great Viewpoint Over the Harbour. We decided to visit here at the last minute just before we departed Sydney. It was well worth the visit and it's a great place to view the Harbour from. Although it was raining heavily at the time it did not spoil our enjoyment.The building of the bridge is well documented in pictures, models and film. If you have any small interest in engineering this is a must. If you don't you still can't go wrong. There are great views of the Bridge from the roof of the Pylon and in particular the Opera House. It's an ideal location to take photographs of the Harbour, even in the rain. I highly recommend this.
Best budget view.. If you cant afford the big bucks to do the full bridge climb do this. Less steps, very affordable and you get to use your own camera.

Great views of the city. The pylon is a great place for views of the city and the harbour, particularly on clear sunny days. It's also reasonably easy to get to. Just one issue, bear in mind that there are quite a lot of steps leading up the pylon. Otherwise, I truly recommend visiting the pylon.
worth it. if you are looking into something not expensive and at the same time you get a nice view of the bridge and the opera house then this is your place, interesting and nice to climb
Serene view of Harbour Bridge. Quite place. Not many people go there as you need to walk. Good panaroma view of Harbour Bridge. A place to relax and picnic.

Fabulous views but a hard place to find. We found this place by accident probably due to all the construction work going on around the lookout. You get a good view of Luna Park and also of the Opera house.

Value For Money. The walk out there can feel long but it's well worth it. The Sydney Harbor Bridge climb is quite expensive and the lookout offers amazing views of harbor and surrounding attractions. The climb up the lookout can be tiring but the view will make wit worthwhile. The museum inside is interesting and it's great to spend time before or after at the Rocks.
Take a walk up. The pylon look out is a birds eye view from the bridge, much cheaper option than walking up/ over , and the views are wonderful.

Wonderful view from the Lookout!. It was a bit difficult to find the entrance to the Pylon Lookout/Museum - but it was worth the extra walking we did to find it. The view of Sydney Harbor cannot be beat - you can walk all the way around the top of the pylon and see many different areas of Sydney as well.

Great value option to the bridge climb. Fantastic views and a bit of history as a bonus. Not only that, it's a lot cheaper than the bridge climb, and takes a lot less time. Walk across the bridge to Milson's point afterwards, and have a cafe moment harbourside in Kiribilli

Value for money, stunning views. This is a great, compact museum and lookout. I enjoyed the history and the views are wonderful! It's not very big up the top so be prepared to share the space, but this is a great way to explore the bridge.
